

===== PAGE 1 =====

Data Blocks
(eventfilings_L3_v1)
GET https://plus.dnb.com/v1/data/duns/{dunsNumber}
The Data Block API is intended to vend Data Blocks to customers transactionally based on a request for a single DUNS.
Monitoring : Available. Please refer guide for details.
Request Parameters
Query Parameters
Name Details
blockIDs [string] Required e.g.: blockID
The block ID provided by Dun & Bradstreet that identifies the data block to be returned.
Multiple values can be included, separated by commas.
tradeUp [string] e.g.: hq
Indicates if the Headquarters D-U-N-S Number should be returned if a Branch is requested.
Valid values:
* hq: If the provided D-U-N-S Number is a Branch, the Headquarter D-U-N-S Number is returned.
* domhq: If the provided D-U-N-S Number is a Branch, the Domestic Headquarter D-U-N-S Number is returned.
If the requested D-U-N-S Number is not a Branch, that D-U-N-S Number will be returned regardless of the value of this parameter.
If the parameter is omitted, the requested D-U-N-S Number is returned even if it is a Branch.
customerReference [string] e.g.: customer reference text
Up to 240 characters for a reference string to be linked to the request in order to support subsequent order reconciliation.
Header Parameters
Name Details

===== PAGE 2 =====

Authorization [string] Required e.g.: Bearer alphanumerictoken
The access token provided by authentication.
Path Parameters
Name Details
dunsNumber [string] Required e.g.: 804735132
A 9-character numeric string identifying the entity by its Dun & Bradstreet D-U-N-S number.
Response(s)
Response for HTTP Status Code : 200
Name Details
transactionDetail [object] Required
The information used to process this request.
transactionDetail.transactionID [string] Required e.g.: rlh-hi9puyoijk-jop8u-kd-d-1
A value assigned by the Dun & Bradstreet application to uniquely identify this request.
transactionDetail.transactionTimestamp [string] Required e.g.: 2017-02-21T17:46:19.839Z
The date and time, in ISO 8601 UTC Z standard, when this response was created.
transactionDetail.inLanguage [string] Required e.g.: en-US
An IETF BCP 47 code value that defines the language in which this product was rendered.
inquiryDetail [object]
The criteria used to process this request.
inquiryDetail.duns [string] e.g.: 804735132
The D-U-N-S number provided in the request.
inquiryDetail.blockIDs [array (string)] e.g.: blockID
The blockIDs provided in the request.
inquiryDetail.tradeUp [string] e.g.: hq
The value of the tradeUp parameter provided in the request.

===== PAGE 3 =====

inquiryDetail.customerReference [string] e.g.: Some text to describe the request.
A reference string provided by the customer for this particular transaction.
blockStatus [array (object)]
Records the status of the data blocks requested by the customer.
blockStatus.blockID [string] Required e.g.: blockID
The unique identifier for the data block.
blockStatus.status [string] Required e.g.: OK
The current status of the data block fulfilled in this response.
Possible values:
* OK
* Unavailable
* Insufficient data
blockStatus.reason [string] e.g.: Data is not available
Any specific reason why the data block is not delivered in this response.
Possible values:
* Data is partially available or not available.
* Data is not available for the branch.
* Data is not available on the requested country code.
organization [object]
The details of the entity.
organization.duns [string] e.g.: 804735132
The D-U-N-S® Number, a proprietary organizational identifier owned and managed by Dun & Bradstreet
Inc, provides unique identification of a subject organization, in accordance with the Data Universal
Numbering System (D-U-N-S®).
organization.countryISOAlpha2Code [string] e.g.: US
The two-letter country code, defined by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) ISO
3166-1 scheme, identifying the country in which the entity is located.
Note: Please refer to Country Code Substitutions Table
[/html/resources/CountryCodes.html#country-substitute] for the country code substitutions.
organization.primaryName [string] e.g.: GORMAN MANUFACTURING COMPANY, INC.
Single name by which the organization is primarily known or identified.
organization.hasCompanyMoved [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the company has changed its location at least once to a different

===== PAGE 4 =====

address than what was available in our records.
organization.documentFilings [array (object)]
Records details of documents which are on file at a registry or similar body.
organization.documentFilings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When true, this indicates that this record is under review by Dun & Bradstreet and should not be treated as
final.
When false, this indicates that this record is not under review by Dun & Bradstreet.
organization.documentFilings.isPrimary [boolean] e.g.: true
When true, this indicates that this filing should be considered as primary filing for this subject.
When false, this indicates that this filing should not be considered as primary filing for this subject.
organization.documentFilings.documentType [object]
Records the type of document which is on file e.g. an annual return or a financial statement.
organization.documentFilings.documentType.description [string] e.g.: Annual Return
Text which describes the type of document which is on file e.g. an annual return or a financial statement.
organization.documentFilings.documentType.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 10248
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet which describes the type of document which is on file e.g. an
annual return or a financial statement.
Refer to Reference code table "186 [Document Type]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.documentDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The date of the document. This is not to be confused with the date that the document was filed or
published. E.g. For a financial statement this would be the date of the financial year end to which the
statement relates.
organization.documentFilings.filingType [object]
Records the registration that has been filed by a business with a registry body (e.g., "corporation”,
“partnership", "registered name").
organization.documentFilings.filingType.description [string] e.g.: Trademark
Text that represents the registration that has been filed by a business with a registry body (e.g.,
"corporation”, “partnership", "registered name").
organization.documentFilings.filingType.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 27228
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that represents the registration that has been filed by a
business with a registry body (e.g., "corporation”, “partnership", "registered name").
Refer to Reference code table "689 [Business Registration Filing Type]" for all possible values.

===== PAGE 5 =====

organization.documentFilings.filingReferenceDate [array (object)]
Records several different dates relating to a document, e.g., Date Filed, Date Published.
organization.documentFilings.filingReferenceDate.referenceTy
pe[object]
Records the relevance of the date recorded in 'Filing Reference Date', e.g., Date Filed, Date Published
organization.documentFilings.filingReferenceDate.referenceTy
pe.description[string] e.g.: Date Published
Text which defines the relevance of the date recorded in 'Filing Reference Date', e.g., Date Filed, Date
Published
organization.documentFilings.filingReferenceDate.referenceTy
pe.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 15523
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet which defines the relevance of the date recorded in 'Filing
Reference Date', e.g., Date Filed, Date Published
Refer to Reference code table "322 [Filing Reference Date Type]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.filingReferenceDate.referenceD
ate[string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
A date relating to a document that has been registered with an official body.
organization.documentFilings.statusTextEntry [array (object)]
Records the textual status, language and nature of the status of the filed document.
organization.documentFilings.statusTextEntry.statusText [string] e.g.: Cancelled
A textual status of the document filed with the registry or a similar body; e.g., Pending, Cancelled,
Surrendered.
organization.documentFilings.statusTextEntry.isActive [boolean] e.g.: true
When true, this indicates that the status of the registered filing is active.
When false, this indicates that the status of the registered filing is inactive.
organization.documentFilings.statusTextEntry.statusCode [string] e.g.: 11
A code that identifies the status of the document filed with the registry or a similar body; e.g., 11 for
Pending, 04 for Cancelled, 05 for Surrendered.
organization.documentFilings.statusTextEntry.statusDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The date on which the status recorded in Filing Status Text became effective.
organization.documentFilings.statusTextEntry.language [object]
Records the language in which the text has been recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English, French, Italian.
organization.documentFilings.statusTextEntry.language.descri
ption[string] e.g.: English
Text which describes the language in which the text has been recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English,
French, Italian.
organization.documentFilings.statusTextEntry.language.dnbCo
de[integer] e.g.: 39
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet which describes the language in which the text has been

===== PAGE 6 =====

recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English, French, Italian.
Refer to Reference code table "3 [Language]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.registeredNames [array (object)]
Records the names of the subject as quoted in the official registry.
organization.documentFilings.registeredNames.name [string] e.g.: ABC Corp
The name of the subject.
organization.documentFilings.registeredNames.renewalDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
This date indicates that this name of the subject was re-filed with the registry in order to legally retain the
same name; e.g., in the U.S., the renewed date is populated for Trade Names to prevent them from
expiring.
organization.documentFilings.registeredNames.language [object]
Records the language in which the name has been recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English, French, Italian.
organization.documentFilings.registeredNames.language.des
cription[string] e.g.: English
Text which describes the language in which the name has been recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English,
French, Italian.
organization.documentFilings.registeredNames.language.dnb
Code[integer] e.g.: 39
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet which describes the language in which the name has been
recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English, French, Italian.
Refer to Reference code table "3 [Language]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.incorporatedNames [array (object)]
The name which was used to incorporate the business in the territory in which it was incorporated; i.e., in
the U.S., it indicates that the name was used to register in the home state.
organization.documentFilings.incorporatedNames.name [string] e.g.: ABC Corporation
The name of the subject.
organization.documentFilings.incorporatedNames.renewalDat
e[string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
This date indicates that this name of the subject was re-filed with the registry in order to legally retain the
same name; e.g., in the U.S., the renewed date is populated for Trade Names to prevent them from
expiring.
organization.documentFilings.incorporatedNames.language [object]
Records the language in which the name has been recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English, French, Italian.
organization.documentFilings.incorporatedNames.language.d
escription[string] e.g.: English
Text which describes the language in which the name has been recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English,
French, Italian.

===== PAGE 7 =====

organization.documentFilings.incorporatedNames.language.d
nbCode[integer] e.g.: 39
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet which describes the language in which the name has been
recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English, French, Italian.
Refer to Reference code table "3 [Language]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.registeredTradeStyleNames [array (object)]
A name which the business uses and by which it is known other than the formal, official name of the
business. For example D&B is a trading style of Dun & Bradstreet. This would not include names by which
a business may be generally known but which the business itself does not use or promote.
organization.documentFilings.registeredTradeStyleNames.na
me[string] e.g.: ABC Co.
The name of the subject.
organization.documentFilings.registeredTradeStyleNames.ren
ewalDate[string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
This date indicates that this name of the subject was re-filed with the registry in order to legally retain the
same name; e.g., in the U.S., the renewed date is populated for Trade Names to prevent them from
expiring.
organization.documentFilings.registeredTradeStyleNames.lan
guage[object]
Records the language in which the name has been recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English, French, Italian.

French, Italian.

guage.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 39

recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English, French, Italian.
Refer to Reference code table "3 [Language]" for all possible values.

The name of the subject.

ge[object]

ge.description Text which describes the language in which the name has been recorded; e.g., English, U.S. English,
French, Italian.

organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress [array (object)]
The details of the organization's official address as recorded with an external authority.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressCoun
try[object]
The details of the country or region for this address of the organization.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressCoun
try.name[string] e.g.: United States
The country or region for this address of the organization.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressCoun
try.isoAlpha2Code[string] e.g.: US
The 2 letter alpha country code assigned by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO)
identifying the Country/Region for this address of the organization.
Note: Please refer to Country Code Substitutions Table
[/html/resources/CountryCodes.html#country-substitute] for the country code substitutions.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressLocal
ity[object]
The name of the locality for this address of the organization. Locality defined as a district population
cluster. City, town, township, village, borough etc.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressLocal
ity.name[string] e.g.: SAN FRANCISCO
The name of the locality for this address of the organization. Locality defined as a district population
cluster. City, town, township, village, borough etc.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.continentalR
egion[object]
The details of the continent for this address of the organization.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.continentalR
egion.name[string] e.g.: North America
The name of the continent for this address of the organization.
Possible values
Africa
Asia Pacific
Europe
Latin America
Middle East
North America

===== PAGE 9 =====

organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressCoun
ty[object]
The details of the geographical area of a Country or Region for this address of the organization. Countries
divide their geography into smaller sub divisions.
County is an example of a commonly used subdivision. Often found in UK.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressCoun
ty.name[string] e.g.: SAN MATEO
The name of the geographical area of a Country or Region for this address of the organization.
Countries subdivide their geography into smaller sub divisions. County is an example of a commonly used
subdivision, often found in the UK.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressRegi
on[object]
The name of the geographical area for this address of the organization. For Example New Jersey.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressRegi
on.name[string] e.g.: California
The name of the geographical area for this address of the organization. For Example New Jersey.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.addressRegi
on.abbreviatedName[string] e.g.: NJ
The shortened name of the geographical area for this address of the organization. For example NJ for the
US State New Jersey within Country United States.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.postalCode [string] e.g.: 941109999
The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.streetAddres
s[object]
The details of the street address for this address of the organization.
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.streetAddres
s.line1[string] e.g.: 492 KOLLER ST
The first line of the address where the entity is located.
The first line of this address of the organization. For example The Point in the address
The Point
37 North Wharf Road
London
W2 1AF
organization.documentFilings.registeredAddress.streetAddres [string] e.g.: Suite 100

===== PAGE 10 =====

s.line2 The second line of this address of the organization.
For example 37 North Wharf Road in the address
The Point
37 North Wharf Road
London
W2 1AF

organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers [array (object)]
The details of role players involved in a Legal Event as recorded in court papers and identifies the part
each one plays.
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.fullName [string] e.g.: Leslie Ann Smith
The highest ranking key stakeholder's given and surname in addition to the middle name and name suffix
(when available) listed on one field if the key stakeholder is an individual. This will be submitted in the
appropriate format for the local country. If the highest ranking key stakeholder is an organization, the name
of the organization will be populated in the full name field.
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.positions [array (object)]
The details on the job position the principal or manager holds or has held in the entity.
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.positions.description [string] e.g.: Chairman Executive Committee
The job position the principal or manager holds or has held in the entity (e.g., Financial Director, Managing
Director, Sales Director, Operations Manager).
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.positions.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 95
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet to identify the job position the principal or manager holds or
has held in the entity.
Refer to Reference code table "5 [Position] & 198 [Employee Position]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.address [object]
The details of the Primary Address at which the organization is located or conducts operations.
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.address.addressCo
untry[object]
The details of the country or region for this address of the organization.
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.address.addressCo
untry.name[string] e.g.: United States
The country or region for this address of the organization.
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.address.addressCo
untry.isoAlpha2Code[string] e.g.: US
The 2 letter alpha country code assigned by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO)
identifying the Country/Region for this address of the organization.
Note: Please refer to Country Code Substitutions Table
[/html/resources/CountryCodes.html#country-substitute] for the country code substitutions.

ality[object]

Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

ription[string] e.g.: Shareholder

organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.duns [string] e.g.: 804735132
The D-U-N-S® Number, a proprietary organizational identifier owned and managed by Dun & Bradstreet
Inc, provides unique identification of a subject organization, in accordance with the Data Universal
Numbering System (D-U-N-S®).
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.startDate [string] e.g.: 2017-10-30
The date when the role player originally started its business activities.
organization.documentFilings.rolePlayers.isActive [boolean] e.g.: true

===== PAGE 17 =====

When true, this indicates that the role player is actively engaged in activities regarding the filing as
recorded in the document filed with the registry or similar body. When false, this indicates that the role
player is no longer engaged in activities regarding the filing as recorded in the document filed with the
registry or similar body
organization.documentFilings.filingReportedDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The date on which the Filing Details were obtained by D&B.
organization.documentFilings.filingVerifiedDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The date on which D&B reviewed the reported content of the Filing Details to ensure accuracy.
organization.documentFilings.filedDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The date of the document. This is not to be confused with the date that the document was filed or
published. E.g. For a financial statement this would be the date of the financial year end to which the
statement relates.
organization.documentFilings.filingApprovedDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The date when the Board of Directors approved the financial statement accounts. In most countries, the
subject is legally required to file within a certain timeframe; e.g. in Belgium within 1 month.
organization.documentFilings.fiscalPeriodEndDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The financial year end date for the subject as specified in the filed document.
organization.documentFilings.accountsLevel [object]
Specifies the account type.
organization.documentFilings.accountsLevel.description [string] e.g.: Full Accounts
Text that specifies the account type.
organization.documentFilings.accountsLevel.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 18939
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the account type.
Refer to Reference code table "506 [Account Level]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.registrationNumbers [array (object)]
The details of the organization's registration numbers issued by a recognized external authority to uniquely
identify subjects. The issuing authority may be a Registration Authority, Government Department or
Commercial Enterprise (e.g., Chamber of Commerce numbers, VAT numbers).
organization.documentFilings.registrationNumbers.registration
Number[string] e.g.: 12-3456789
The number or alphanumeric value assigned by a recognized external authority that either uniquely
identifies or helps to identify the organization.
organization.documentFilings.registrationNumbers.typeDescri
ption[string] e.g.: Federal Taxpayer Identification Number (US)
The official name of the organization identifier assigned by a recognized external authority (e.g.. Australian
Company Number, Federal Taxpayer Identification Number, Value Added Tax Number).

===== PAGE 18 =====

organization.documentFilings.registrationNumbers.typeDnBC
ode[integer] e.g.: 6863
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet to identify the type of organization registration number. For
example, 2541 stands for company number issued by the UK Companies House.
Refer to Reference code table "7 [Registration Number Type]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.incorporatedDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The date on which the Subject is incorporated under the law of a specific jurisdiction, as recorded in the
document filed with the registry or a similar body.
organization.documentFilings.incorporatedRegion [object]
Records the locally governed area which forms part of a centrally governed nation in which the Subject is
incorporated under the law of a specific jurisdiction, as recorded in the document filed with the registry or a
similar body.
organization.documentFilings.incorporatedRegion.name [string] e.g.: California
A locally governed area which forms part of a centrally governed nation in which the Subject is
incorporated under the law of a specific jurisdiction, as recorded in the document filed with the registry or a
similar body. As a guiding principle this is a geographic area which could theoretically exist as a separate
nation. In the U.S. this would be a State in the UK this would be one of the Home Nations.
organization.documentFilings.hasPerpetualOperations [boolean] e.g.: true
When true, this indicates the business is allowed by its registration to conduct operations indefinitely.
When false, this indicates the business is not allowed by its registration to conduct operations indefinitely.
organization.documentFilings.capitals [array (object)]
The details of the current share capital information.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalType [object]
The details for the entity's capital type.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalType.description [string] e.g.: Issued
The type of the capital (e.g., Issued, Paid in, Nominal/Authorized).
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalType.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 1017
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet to identify the type of the capital.
Refer to Reference code table "21 [Capital Type]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.startDate [string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date on which the Capital Amount was first registered.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalAmount [object]
The details of the capital amount.

===== PAGE 19 =====

organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalAmount.value [number] e.g.: 534378
The amount of the capital.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalAmount.currency [string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks [array (object)]
The details of the composition of each type of stock equity the entity employs, as recorded in the
document filed with the registry or a similar body.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.capitalSto
ckType[object]
Describes a class of shares which form a part of the Capital Type; e.g., Preference, Cumulative
Preference, Redeemable, Ordinary.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.capitalSto
ckType.description[string] e.g.: Preference
Text that describes a class of shares which form a part of the Capital Type; e.g., Preference, Cumulative
Preference, Redeemable, Ordinary.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.capitalSto
ckType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 3759
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that describes a class of shares which form a part of the
Capital Type; e.g., Preference, Cumulative Preference, Redeemable, Ordinary.
Refer to Reference code table "114 [Capital Stock Type]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.subTypeT
ext[string] e.g.: Ordinary A
The sub-category of share classification that has been specifically defined by the entity. For example, the
ordinary shares of a subject may be broken down into Ordinary A, Ordinary B etc.; where the A and B
categories have different rights or characteristics. In this example 2 Capital Stock Detail aggregates will be
created. In both aggregates the Capital Stock Type Code will be set to 3761 [Ordinary] but the Capital
Stock Sub Type Text will be set to 'A' in the first occurrence and 'B' in the second.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.stockPar
ValueAmount[object]
The details of the value of each share of this Stock Type upon initial offering. It is also known as face value
or stated value.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.stockPar
ValueAmount.value[number] e.g.: 5.34
The monetary value of each share of this Stock Type upon initial offering.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.stockPar
ValueAmount.currency[string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.stockAmo [object]

===== PAGE 20 =====

unt Records the total monetary value of each Capital Stock Type.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.stockAmo
unt.value[number] e.g.: 250500.5
The total monetary value of each Capital Stock Type; e.g., if there are 100 preference shares with a par
value of 5 euros per share the recorded amount is 500; i.e., 100 times 5.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.stockAmo
unt.currency[string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.quantity [integer] e.g.: 2500
The total number of shares within each Capital Stock Type.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.hasVoting
Rights[boolean] e.g.: true
When true, this indicates that the shares of the type specified in Capital Stock Type carry voting rights.
When false, this indicates that the shares of the type specified in Capital Stock Type do not carry voting
rights.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.hasNoPar
Value[boolean] e.g.: true
When true, this indicates that this Capital Stock Type is referring to shares with no face value.
When false, this indicates that this Capital Stock Type is referring to shares with face value.
organization.documentFilings.capitals.capitalStocks.isConverti
ble[boolean] e.g.: true
When true, this indicates that the shares of the type specified in Capital Stock Type can be switched to
another Capital Stock Type.
When false, this indicates that the shares of the type specified in Capital Stock Type cannot be switched to
another Capital Stock Type.
organization.documentFilings.taxes [array (object)]
Records details about various kinds of taxes for which the Subject is responsible as recorded in the
document filed with the registry or a similar body.
organization.documentFilings.taxes.taxType [object]
Records the kind of the financial charge or levy imposed by the appropriate jurisdiction on the Subject as
recorded in the document filed with registry or a similar body; e.g., Franchise, Corporate.
organization.documentFilings.taxes.taxType.description [string] e.g.: Corporate Tax
Text identifying the kind of the financial charge or levy imposed by the appropriate jurisdiction on the
Subject as recorded in the document filed with registry or a similar body; e.g., Franchise, Corporate.
organization.documentFilings.taxes.taxType.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 14113
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet, identifying the kind of the financial charge or levy imposed
by the appropriate jurisdiction on the Subject as recorded in the document filed with registry or a similar
body; e.g., Franchise, Corporate.

===== PAGE 21 =====

Refer to Reference code table "435 [Tax Type]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.taxes.taxPercentage [number] e.g.: 23.5
The rate by which the tax identified by the tax type code is calculated.
organization.documentFilings.taxes.taxItems [array (object)]
Records any financial items in terms of monetary amounts relating to the tax identified by the Tax Type;
e.g., Tax Amount, Balance Tax Amount, Taxable Capital Amount, Paid Tax Amount.
organization.documentFilings.taxes.taxItems.value [number] e.g.: 205500.5

The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).

organization.documentFilings.taxes.paymentAssessmentDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-30
The date on which the evaluation took place of the subject's ability to meet the tax obligations as recorded

organization.documentFilings.principals [array (object)]
Records information of several different Principals for the subject as recorded in the document filed with
the registry or a similar body. In this aggregate, a principal is a person or organization that currently has or
previously had a relationship with the subject; e.g., management, employees, service providers.
organization.documentFilings.principals.fullName [string] e.g.: Leslie Ann Smith
The highest ranking key stakeholder's given and surname in addition to the middle name and name suffix
(when available) listed on one field if the key stakeholder is an individual. This will be submitted in the
appropriate format for the local country. If the highest ranking key stakeholder is an organization, the name
of the organization will be populated in the full name field.
organization.documentFilings.principals.priority [integer] e.g.: 3
The relative display order of this principal compared to other principals of the entity; the lower the number,
the earlier it is presented.
organization.documentFilings.principals.positions [array (object)]
The details on the job position the principal or manager holds or has held in the entity.
organization.documentFilings.principals.positions.description [string] e.g.: Chairman Executive Committee
The job position the principal or manager holds or has held in the entity (e.g., Financial Director, Managing
Director, Sales Director, Operations Manager).
organization.documentFilings.principals.positions.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 95
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet to identify the job position the principal or manager holds or
has held in the entity.
Refer to Reference code table "5 [Position] & 198 [Employee Position]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.principals.positions.jobTitles [array (object)]
Text string that denotes a position held by the highest ranking key stakeholder in the organization or
recording of the title used by the organization to describe this person's job e.g., Leader Global
Communication, Manager National Technical Support Center.
organization.documentFilings.principals.positions.jobTitles.title [string] e.g.: President
Text string that denotes a position held by the highest ranking key stakeholder in the organization or
recording of the title used by the organization to describe this person's job e.g., Leader Global
Communication, Manager National Technical Support Center.
organization.documentFilings.principals.address [object]
The details of the Primary Address at which the organization is located or conducts operations.

organization.documentFilings.industryCodes [array (object)]
Records several different Industry Codes for the subject as recorded in the document filed with the registry
or a similar body; possibly of different types.
organization.documentFilings.industryCodes.code [string] e.g.: 323111
An alphanumeric value assigned to an organization categorizing the business activities performed at its
location. Business activities are coded using standardized coding schemes. For example, 1611 represents
the highway and street construction industry in the U.S. SIC (Standard Industrial Classification) 1987
system.
organization.documentFilings.industryCodes.description [string] e.g.: Commercial Printing 
The description of the business activities represented by the Industry Code as defined in the coding
scheme identified by the Industry Code Type Description. For example, 'highway and street construction' is
the description of industry code 1611 in the U.S. SIC 1987 system.
organization.documentFilings.industryCodes.typeDescription [string] e.g.: North American Industry Classification System 2012
The details of the standardized coding scheme used to classify the business activities of an organization.
This can be an externally recognized coding scheme as for instance North American Industry
Classification System (NAICS) or a proprietary scheme like D&B SIC-8.
organization.documentFilings.industryCodes.typeDnBCode [integer] e.g.: 24664
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet to identify the industry coding scheme.
Industry schemes supported currently:
D&B Industry Code (3599)
NAICS Code (30832)
US 1987 SIC Code (399)
NACE Revision 2 (29104)
D&B Hoovers Industry Code (25838)
Major Industry Category (24657)
Local Activity Codes (specific to markets)
Refer to Reference code table "30 [Industry Code Type]" for all possible values.
organization.documentFilings.industryCodes.priority [integer] e.g.: 1
A number identifying the order in which this industry code should be presented relative to other industry

===== PAGE 26 =====

codes of the same type. Priority is based on the importance of the business activity to the organization.

of the document with the registry or a similar body, e.g., Business Name Change, Agent Data Amended.
Refer to Reference code table "433 [Filing Reason]" for all possible values.

organization.legalEvents [object]
The details of legal events associated with an organization.
* A legal event is an event of a legal, formal nature that has been registered against an organization by a
recognized authority, during the business lifecycle
* A legal event must relate to an enacted law that is applicable to the associated organization
* A legal event must be formally documented or recorded on an official list or register that is publicly
available
* A legal event must be sourced from a recognized authority on an official authority authorized by a
government
* A legal event that occurs during the formation, funding, governance, status change and closure of an
organization
organization.legalEvents.hasLegalEvents [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that one or more Legal Events are registered against the organization.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenLegalEvents [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates that an organization is subject to a legal action for which the specific details are currently
unknown. When set to 'True,' D&B has received information to suggest the organization has at least one
active or on-going legal event.
organization.legalEvents.hasSuits [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates a disagreement between organizations that is brought to a court of law for a decision.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenSuits [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates a disagreement between organizations that is brought to a court of law for a decision. When set
to 'True,' D&B has received information to suggest the organization has at least one active or on-going suit.
organization.legalEvents.hasLiens [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has a charge against or interest in property to secure payment of a debt or
performance of an obligation.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenLiens [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has a charge against or interest in property to secure payment of a debt or
performance of an obligation. When set to 'True,' D&B has received information to suggest the organization
has at least one on-going lien.

===== PAGE 30 =====

organization.legalEvents.hasBankruptcy [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has officially filed with a legal body that it can no longer pay its outstanding
debts or honor its financial obligations.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenBankruptcy [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has officially filed with a legal body that it can no longer pay its outstanding
debts or honor its financial obligations. When set to 'True,' D&B has received information to suggest the
organization has at least one active or on-going insolvency/bankruptcy event.
organization.legalEvents.hasJudgments [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that a court has ruled or is in the process of making a ruling on a legal proceeding, either in favor
of or against an organization.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenJudgments [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates that a court has ruled or is in the process of making a ruling on a legal proceeding, either in favor
of or against an organization. When set to 'True,' D&B has received information to suggest the organization
has at least one active or on-going judgement.
organization.legalEvents.hasFinancialEmbarrassment [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has experienced or is experiencing severe financial difficulties and whose
long term survival was/is at risk.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenFinancialEmbarrassment [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates that an organization is experiencing severe financial difficulties and whose long term survival is
at risk. When set to 'True,' D&B has received information to suggest the organization has at least one
active or on-going Legal Event affecting its long term survival.
organization.legalEvents.hasCriminalProceedings [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has been charged with financial crime such as corruption, money
laundering, bribery and embezzlement.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenCriminalProceedings [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has been charged with financial crime such as corruption, money
laundering, bribery and embezzlement. When set to 'True,' D&B has received information to suggest the
organization has at least one active or on-going criminal proceeding.
organization.legalEvents.hasClaims [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization asserts a right to money, property, or a type of legal action.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenClaims [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates that an organization asserts a right to money, property, or a type of legal action.
When set to 'True,' D&B has received information to suggest the organization has at least one active or
on-going claim.
organization.legalEvents.hasDebarments [boolean] e.g.: true

===== PAGE 31 =====

DO NOT USE: Please use organization.exclusions.hasActiveExclusions and
organization.exclusions.hasInactiveExclusions
Indicates that a government agency has taken legal action to prevent an organization from participating in
certain activities, including but not limited to contracts and grants.
organization.legalEvents.hasOpenDebarments [boolean] e.g.: false
DO NOT USE: Please use organization.exclusions.hasActiveExclusions
Indicates that a government agency has taken legal action to prevent an organization from participating in
certain activities, including but not limited to contracts and grants. When set to 'True,' D&B has received
information to suggest the organization has at least one active or on-going debarment.
organization.legalEvents.hasInsolvency [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization is unable to pay its debts. This includes but is not limited to bankruptcy,
receivership and liquidation.
organization.legalEvents.hasLiquidation [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization is being wound up with its assets being converted into cash or cash
equivalents to pay off its debts.
organization.legalEvents.hasSuspensionOfPayments [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates that an organization has been authorized to pause its payments to creditors for a given period of
time due to current financial difficulties.
organization.legalEvents.hasOtherLegalEvents [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the entity has legal actions targeting the entity that cannot be recorded in any of the
defined categories.
- If true, this entity is associated with other legal events.
- If false, this entity does not have other legal events.
- null; if Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.legalEvents.judgments [object]
The details of formal decisions made by a court that involved the entity.

The date of the most recent event of this event.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM
organization.legalEvents.judgments.openCount [integer] e.g.: 12
The number of filings that are in open status.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.openAmount [object]
The details of the monetary value involved in the total open events of this event type.

Alpha3 code format.

item.

event was heard or decreed. This may describe the area of law in which the court specializes (e.g. court of

organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.endDate [string] e.g.: 2017-10-31
The date indicates that the Legal Event procedure ended.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.endIndicator [boolean] e.g.: false
When set to "true" this indicates that the Event has ceased, i.e., this is historical information.
When set to "false" this indicates that the Event is still outstanding or ongoing, i.e., this is current
information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.

organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.filingAmountCompa [object]

===== PAGE 43 =====

risonType Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.filingAmountCompa
risonType.description[string] e.g.: less than
Text that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values;
e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,
while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.filingAmountCompa
risonType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 16804
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of
data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a
later date. For example, the value to be awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
Refer to Reference code table "410 [Comparison Operator]" for all possible values.

The chapter that applies to the filing of this event.

Receivership, Liquidation / Dissolution

on[string] e.g.: Suit/Financial Judgement/Lien

represents a single organization inclusive of any branches. Consolidated means it represents an
organization inclusive of any branches and any subsidiaries.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.financials.informati
onScope.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 9067
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet to identify the organizational scope of the Summary
Financials values.
Refer to Reference code table "192 [Information Scope]" for all possible values.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.financials.isAudited [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if the Latest Financials' accounts have been reviewed by a qualified accountant independent of
the organization and the accountant has signed the financial statement certifying it is accurate and
complete.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.financials.isFinal [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the financial figures are for the entity's closing statement.
- If true, the financial figures are for the entity's closing statement.
- If false, the financial figures are not for the entity's closing statement.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.financials.isFiscal [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the Latest Financials' financial figures cover a full year accounting period.

LossStatement[object]

and expenses incurred during a specified accounting period. The P&L statement is synonymous with the
income statement.

organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the Public Records report which would disregard this
indicator setting.
When set to "false" this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.

organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.priority [string] e.g.: 5
A number that may be used to define the order in which the legal event should be presented relative to the
other legal events where the lower the number the earlier the data is presented. Events within the same
legal process can be identified using the priority group.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.priorityGroup [string] e.g.: 2
A number that may be used to identify multiple legal events as belonging together as part of the same
overall legal process. Within a group the priority may then be used to ensure that the legal events within
the group are presented continuously and in the correct order.

organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.rolePlayers.standar

organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.rolePlayers.standar
dRating.scoreDate[string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date when the score was assigned or last changed. Scores are continuously monitored and
recalculated as any input variables changes. In the event that the score could not be assigned on the
entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:
YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.

- If false, connection to the telephone number is successful.
organization.legalEvents.judgments.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.telephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

text that describes the nature of the legal body at which the legal event was heard or decreed. This may
describe the area of law in which the court specializes (e.g. court of employment) or the legal seniority of
the court (e.g. high court, supreme court etc.)
organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.courtType.dnbCod
e[integer] e.g.: 5337
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that describes the nature of the legal body at which the legal
event was heard or decreed. This may describe the area of law in which the court specializes (e.g. court of
employment) or the legal seniority of the court (e.g. high court, supreme court etc.)
Refer to Reference code table "132 [Court Type]" for all possible values.

The different classifications of creditors to whom money is owed by the entity. The priority in which the
creditors are paid is based on the assigned classification.

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.endDate [string] e.g.: 2017-10-31
The date indicates that the Legal Event procedure ended.
organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.endIndicator [boolean] e.g.: false
When set to "true" this indicates that the Event has ceased, i.e., this is historical information.
When set to "false" this indicates that the Event is still outstanding or ongoing, i.e., this is current
information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.filingAmountComp
arisonType[object]
Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

===== PAGE 74 =====

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.filingAmountComp
arisonType.description[string] e.g.: less than
Text that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values;
e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,
while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.filingAmountComp
arisonType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 16804
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of
data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a
later date. For example, the value to be awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
Refer to Reference code table "410 [Comparison Operator]" for all possible values.

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.impactAmount [object]
Records the income acquired by the subject as a result of this legal event; e.g. the income acquired as a

===== PAGE 83 =====

result of the sale of the subject's assets.

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the Public Records report which would disregard this
indicator setting.
When set to "false" this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.priority [string] e.g.: 5
A number that may be used to define the order in which the legal event should be presented relative to the

overall legal process. Within a group the priority may then be used to ensure that the legal events within

the group are presented continuously and in the correct order.

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.rolePlayers.standa

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.rolePlayers.standa
rdRating.scoreDate[string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date when the score was assigned or last changed. Scores are continuously monitored and
recalculated as any input variables changes. In the event that the score could not be assigned on the
entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:
YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.

organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.isdCode[string] e.g.: 1
A series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in another Country, it is
comprised of an International Dialing Prefix followed by the Country Code. These are also referred to as
Country Calling Code or Country Dial-In Code.
organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.isUnreachable[boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates whether the telephone number can be connected to successfully.
- If true, connection to the telephone number is unsuccessful.

===== PAGE 93 =====

- If false, connection to the telephone number is successful.
organization.legalEvents.bankruptcy.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.telephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.collaterals.collatera
lDetails.isUsed[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true", this identifies that the collateral asset owned by the Subject is no longer considered a
brand new item.
When set to "false", this identifies that the collateral asset owned by the Subject is considered a brand new
item.

organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.endDate [string] e.g.: 2017-10-31
The date indicates that the Legal Event procedure ended.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.endIndicator [boolean] e.g.: false
When set to "true" this indicates that the Event has ceased, i.e., this is historical information.
When set to "false" this indicates that the Event is still outstanding or ongoing, i.e., this is current
information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.eventDuration [string] e.g.: 12 months
The amount of time this event lasted.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.filingAmount [object]
The details of the amount of relief sought by all of the plaintiffs in the suit.

cy[string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed

===== PAGE 105 =====

(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.filingAmount.value [number] e.g.: 1000000
The total amount of relief sought by all of the plaintiffs in the suit.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.filingAmountCompa
risonType[object]
Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.filingAmountCompa
risonType.description[string] e.g.: less than
Text that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values;
e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,
while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.filingAmountCompa
risonType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 16804
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of
data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a
later date. For example, the value to be awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
Refer to Reference code table "410 [Comparison Operator]" for all possible values.

- If false, the entity has not been part of a historical event.

Records the income acquired by the subject as a result of this legal event; e.g. the income acquired as a
result of the sale of the subject's assets.

organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the Public Records report which would disregard this
indicator setting.
When set to "false" this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.juridictionType [object]
Describes the level of government applying the laws applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.juridictionType.desc
ription[string] e.g.: County
Text that describes the level of government applying the laws applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.

Code[integer] e.g.: 14809

applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.
Refer to Reference code table "434 [Jurisdiction Type]" for all possible values.

organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.priority [string] e.g.: 5
A number that may be used to define the order in which the legal event should be presented relative to the
other legal events where the lower the number the earlier the data is presented. Events within the same
legal process can be identified using the priority group.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.priorityGroup [string] e.g.: 2
A number that may be used to identify multiple legal events as belonging together as part of the same
overall legal process. Within a group the priority may then be used to ensure that the legal events within
the group are presented continuously and in the correct order.

entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:
YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.

===== PAGE 124 =====

ne.isdCode A series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in another Country, it is
comprised of an International Dialing Prefix followed by the Country Code. These are also referred to as
Country Calling Code or Country Dial-In Code.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.isUnreachable[boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates whether the telephone number can be connected to successfully.
- If true, connection to the telephone number is unsuccessful.
- If false, connection to the telephone number is successful.
organization.legalEvents.insolvency.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.telephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.collaterals.collateral
Details.isUsed[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true", this identifies that the collateral asset owned by the Subject is no longer considered a
brand new item.
When set to "false", this identifies that the collateral asset owned by the Subject is considered a brand new
item.

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.endDate [string] e.g.: 2017-10-31

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.endIndicator [boolean] e.g.: false
When set to "true" this indicates that the Event has ceased, i.e., this is historical information.
When set to "false" this indicates that the Event is still outstanding or ongoing, i.e., this is current
information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.filingAmountCompa
risonType[object]
Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.filingAmountCompa
risonType.description[string] e.g.: less than
Text that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values;
e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,
while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.filingAmountCompa
risonType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 16804
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of
data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a
later date. For example, the value to be awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
Refer to Reference code table "410 [Comparison Operator]" for all possible values.

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the Public Records report which would disregard this
indicator setting.
When set to "false" this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.priority [string] e.g.: 5
A number that may be used to define the order in which the legal event should be presented relative to the
other legal events where the lower the number the earlier the data is presented. Events within the same
legal process can be identified using the priority group.
organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.priorityGroup [string] e.g.: 2
A number that may be used to identify multiple legal events as belonging together as part of the same
overall legal process. Within a group the priority may then be used to ensure that the legal events within
the group are presented continuously and in the correct order.
organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.publishedDate [string] e.g.: 2011-02-14
The date to support the recording of the Publication Date for an official document registered with an
Official Body.

the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.rolePlayers.standar
dRating.financialStrength[string] e.g.: 3A

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.rolePlayers.standar
dRating.scoreDate[string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date when the score was assigned or last changed. Scores are continuously monitored and
recalculated as any input variables changes. In the event that the score could not be assigned on the
entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:

===== PAGE 155 =====

YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.

e[string] e.g.: 2017-10-30

organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne[array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.isdCode[string] e.g.: 1
A series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in another Country, it is
comprised of an International Dialing Prefix followed by the Country Code. These are also referred to as
Country Calling Code or Country Dial-In Code.
organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.isUnreachable[boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates whether the telephone number can be connected to successfully.
- If true, connection to the telephone number is unsuccessful.
- If false, connection to the telephone number is successful.
organization.legalEvents.liquidation.filings.rolePlayers.telepho
ne.telephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

which creditors filed claims, the date on which a bankruptcy petition was read, the date on which a trial
hearing took place.

Records details of different groups of assets which are impacted by this Legal Event.

Text that describes the class of asset at a high level, e.g. Vehicles.

A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that describes the class of asset at a high level, e.g.
Vehicles.

(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).

organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls[array (object)]
Records information about an individual item/asset that the subject has used as security for this Financing
Event.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls.isUsed[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true", this identifies that the collateral asset owned by the Subject is no longer considered a
brand new item.
When set to "false", this identifies that the collateral asset owned by the Subject is considered a brand new
item.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls.manufacturedYear[string] e.g.: 2001
The year in which the construction of the item; e.g., a ship, was completed.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls.manufactureName[string] e.g.: Ford Motors
The name of the business that built the item being held as collateral in a business transaction.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls.modelName[string] e.g.: Mustang
An alphanumeric name assigned by the manufacturer to the asset; e.g., Mustang, RX8, Pavilion, T60, 747.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls.modelYear[string] e.g.: 2002
The year that the manufacturer assigned to the model based on the expected release of the model to the
public.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls.serialNumber[string] e.g.: VX1234
A reference number or text assigned by the manufacturer for uniquely identifying the manufactured item.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls.textEntry[array (object)]
Records multiple textual descriptions, language and nature of textual Collateral Details data for this
Financing Event that cannot be recorded in the defined fields.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai
ls.textEntry.priority[integer] e.g.: 1
A number which may be used to identify multiple occurrences of Text Entry as belonging together as part
of the same block of text. Within a group the Display Sequence may then be used to ensure that the Text
Entry occurrences within the group are presented in the correct order.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.collaterals.collateralDetai

of the defined elements.

organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.endIndicator [boolean] e.g.: false
When set to "true" this indicates that the Event has ceased, i.e., this is historical information.

===== PAGE 168 =====

When set to "false" this indicates that the Event is still outstanding or ongoing, i.e., this is current
information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.

organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.filingAmountComparison
Type[object]
Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.filingAmountComparison
Type.description[string] e.g.: less than
Text that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values;
e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,
while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.filingAmountComparison
Type.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 16804
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of
data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a
later date. For example, the value to be awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
Refer to Reference code table "410 [Comparison Operator]" for all possible values.

organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the Public Records report which would disregard this
indicator setting.
When set to "false" this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.

organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.priority [string] e.g.: 5
A number that may be used to define the order in which the legal event should be presented relative to the
other legal events where the lower the number the earlier the data is presented. Events within the same
legal process can be identified using the priority group.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.priorityGroup [string] e.g.: 2
A number that may be used to identify multiple legal events as belonging together as part of the same
overall legal process. Within a group the priority may then be used to ensure that the legal events within
the group are presented continuously and in the correct order.

the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,

organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.rolePlayers.standardRati
ng.financialStrength[string] e.g.: 3A
The overall size of the entity from a financial perspective. It may be based on the net worth or issued

organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.rolePlayers.standardRati
ng.riskSegment[string] e.g.: 4
Creditworthiness of the entity in terms of its overall financial condition or risk to creditors.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.rolePlayers.standardRati
ng.scoreDate[string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date when the score was assigned or last changed. Scores are continuously monitored and
recalculated as any input variables changes. In the event that the score could not be assigned on the
entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:
YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.

organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.isd
Code[string] e.g.: 1
A series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in another Country, it is
comprised of an International Dialing Prefix followed by the Country Code. These are also referred to as
Country Calling Code or Country Dial-In Code.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.is
Unreachable[boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates whether the telephone number can be connected to successfully.
- If true, connection to the telephone number is unsuccessful.
- If false, connection to the telephone number is successful.
organization.legalEvents.suits.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.tel
ephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.endIndicator [boolean] e.g.: false
When set to "true" this indicates that the Event has ceased, i.e., this is historical information.

information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.

organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.filingAmountComparison
Type[object]
Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

Type.description[string] e.g.: less than

e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,
while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

Type.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 16804
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of
data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a

===== PAGE 200 =====

later date. For example, the value to be awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

on which the data was submitted.
