pe.description The organizational scope of the values within the Summary Financials section. Individual means it
represents a single organization inclusive of any branches. Consolidated means it represents an
organization inclusive of any branches and any subsidiaries.

- If false, the financial figures are not for the entity's closing statement.

===== PAGE 209 =====

organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the Public Records report which would disregard this
indicator setting.
When set to "false" this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.juridictionType [object]
Describes the level of government applying the laws applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.

n[string] e.g.: County
Text that describes the level of government applying the laws applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.juridictionType.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 14809
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that describes the level of government applying the laws
applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.
Refer to Reference code table "434 [Jurisdiction Type]" for all possible values.

Records the date of a formal process associated with the Legal Event e.g. the date by which creditors'
claims must be filed, the future date for the reading of a bankruptcy petition.

organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.parentBankruptcy.duns [string] e.g.: 804735132
The D-U-N-S® Number, a proprietary organizational identifier owned and managed by Dun & Bradstreet
Inc, provides unique identification of a subject organization, in accordance with the Data Universal
Numbering System (D-U-N-S®).
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.priority [string] e.g.: 5
A number that may be used to define the order in which the legal event should be presented relative to the
other legal events where the lower the number the earlier the data is presented. Events within the same
legal process can be identified using the priority group.
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.priorityGroup [string] e.g.: 2
A number that may be used to identify multiple legal events as belonging together as part of the same
overall legal process. Within a group the priority may then be used to ensure that the legal events within
the group are presented continuously and in the correct order.

Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

preferred, secured, where preferred creditors have priority over secured creditors.

organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.filingAmount
ComparisonType[object]
Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

ComparisonType.description[string] e.g.: less than
Text that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values;
e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,
while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.filingAmount

A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of
data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a
later date. For example, the value to be awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.standardRati
ng[object]
The most current Standard Dun & Bradstreet Standard Rating assigned to this entity.
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.standardRati
ng.financialStrength[string] e.g.: 3A
The overall size of the entity from a financial perspective. It may be based on the net worth or issued
capital of the entity; the higher the amount, the larger the entity is considered to be.
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.standardRati
ng.riskSegment[string] e.g.: 4
Creditworthiness of the entity in terms of its overall financial condition or risk to creditors.
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.standardRati
ng.scoreDate[string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date when the score was assigned or last changed. Scores are continuously monitored and
recalculated as any input variables changes. In the event that the score could not be assigned on the
entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:
YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.

organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.isd
Code[string] e.g.: 1
A series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in another Country, it is
comprised of an International Dialing Prefix followed by the Country Code. These are also referred to as
Country Calling Code or Country Dial-In Code.
organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.is
Unreachable[boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates whether the telephone number can be connected to successfully.
- If true, connection to the telephone number is unsuccessful.
- If false, connection to the telephone number is successful.

===== PAGE 218 =====

organization.legalEvents.liens.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.tel
ephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.endDate [string] e.g.: 2017-10-31
The date indicates that the Legal Event procedure ended.
organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.endIndicator [boolean] e.g.: false
When set to "true" this indicates that the Event has ceased, i.e., this is historical information.
When set to "false" this indicates that the Event is still outstanding or ongoing, i.e., this is current
information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.

nType[object]
Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.

nType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 16804

cope.description The organizational scope of the values within the Summary Financials section. Individual means it
represents a single organization inclusive of any branches. Consolidated means it represents an
organization inclusive of any branches and any subsidiaries.

===== PAGE 240 =====

organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the Public Records report which would disregard this
indicator setting.
When set to "false" this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.

Describes the level of government applying the laws applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.

Text that describes the level of government applying the laws applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.

applicable to the event, e.g., federal, state.
Refer to Reference code table "434 [Jurisdiction Type]" for all possible values.

organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.priority [string] e.g.: 5
A number that may be used to define the order in which the legal event should be presented relative to the
other legal events where the lower the number the earlier the data is presented. Events within the same
legal process can be identified using the priority group.
organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.priorityGroup [string] e.g.: 2
A number that may be used to identify multiple legal events as belonging together as part of the same
overall legal process. Within a group the priority may then be used to ensure that the legal events within
the group are presented continuously and in the correct order.

organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.rolePlayers.standardRa
ting[object]
The most current Standard Dun & Bradstreet Standard Rating assigned to this entity.
organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.rolePlayers.standardRa
ting.financialStrength[string] e.g.: 3A
The overall size of the entity from a financial perspective. It may be based on the net worth or issued
capital of the entity; the higher the amount, the larger the entity is considered to be.
organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.rolePlayers.standardRa
ting.riskSegment[string] e.g.: 4
Creditworthiness of the entity in terms of its overall financial condition or risk to creditors.
organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.rolePlayers.standardRa
ting.scoreDate[string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date when the score was assigned or last changed. Scores are continuously monitored and
recalculated as any input variables changes. In the event that the score could not be assigned on the
entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:
YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.

organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.i
sdCode[string] e.g.: 1
A series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in another Country, it is
comprised of an International Dialing Prefix followed by the Country Code. These are also referred to as
Country Calling Code or Country Dial-In Code.
organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.i
sUnreachable[boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates whether the telephone number can be connected to successfully.
- If true, connection to the telephone number is unsuccessful.
- If false, connection to the telephone number is successful.

===== PAGE 249 =====

organization.legalEvents.claims.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.t
elephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

Records the nature of the legal body at which the legal event was heard or decreed. This may describe the
area of law in which the court specializes (e.g. court of employment) or the legal seniority of the court (e.g.
high court, supreme court etc.)

the court (e.g. high court, supreme court etc.)

event was heard or decreed. This may describe the area of law in which the court specializes (e.g. court of
employment) or the legal seniority of the court (e.g. high court, supreme court etc.)
Refer to Reference code table "132 [Court Type]" for all possible values.

organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.endDate [string] e.g.: 2017-10-31
The date indicates that the Legal Event procedure ended.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.endIndicator [boolean] e.g.: false
When set to "true" this indicates that the Event has ceased, i.e., this is historical information.
When set to "false" this indicates that the Event is still outstanding or ongoing, i.e., this is current
information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.

organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.filingAmount [object]

===== PAGE 261 =====

ComparisonType Specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values; e.g.,
greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded, while
the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be awarded
must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.filingAmount
ComparisonType.description[string] e.g.: less than
Text that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of data comparisons between two values;
e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of two values being compared is recorded,
while the other value could be derived or become available at a later date. For example, the value to be
awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.filingAmount
ComparisonType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 16804
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that specifies the operator that may be used as the basis of
data comparisons between two values; e.g., greater than, less than, equal to. In some cases only one of
two values being compared is recorded, while the other value could be derived or become available at a
later date. For example, the value to be awarded must be "Less Than" the value recorded.
Refer to Reference code table "410 [Comparison Operator]" for all possible values.

organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.isStopD [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the Public Records report which would disregard this
indicator setting.
When set to "false" this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Legal Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.

other legal events. The lower the number the earlier the data is presented. Events within the same legal

p[string] e.g.: 3

and in the correct order.

remedyFiled.remedyType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 14701
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet that describes the specific kind of relief for the damage
sought or deemed by this legal event; e.g., Actual, Punitive, Injunction, Compensatory.
Refer to Reference code table "430 [Legal Event Remedy Type]" for all possible values.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.
rolePlayerType[object]
The details of the role player's function in the event.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.
rolePlayerType.description[string] e.g.: Shareholder
The function played by this party in the event (e.g., debtor, creditor, liquidator, shareholder, court, plaintiff,
defendant).

organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.

organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.
standardRating[object]
The most current Standard Dun & Bradstreet Standard Rating assigned to this entity.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.
standardRating.financialStrength[string] e.g.: 3A
The overall size of the entity from a financial perspective. It may be based on the net worth or issued
capital of the entity; the higher the amount, the larger the entity is considered to be.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.
standardRating.riskSegment[string] e.g.: 4
Creditworthiness of the entity in terms of its overall financial condition or risk to creditors.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.
standardRating.scoreDate[string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date when the score was assigned or last changed. Scores are continuously monitored and
recalculated as any input variables changes. In the event that the score could not be assigned on the
entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:
YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.
startDate[string] e.g.: 2017-10-30
The date when the role player originally started its business activities.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.t
elephone[array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.t
elephone.isdCode[string] e.g.: 1
A series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in another Country, it is
comprised of an International Dialing Prefix followed by the Country Code. These are also referred to as
Country Calling Code or Country Dial-In Code.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.t
elephone.isUnreachable[boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates whether the telephone number can be connected to successfully.
- If true, connection to the telephone number is unsuccessful.
- If false, connection to the telephone number is successful.
organization.legalEvents.otherLegalEvents.filings.rolePlayers.t
elephone.telephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.


===== PAGE 280 =====

A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

organization.commercialCollectionClaims.filings.hasLegalActi
on[boolean] e.g.: true
When "true", it denotes that pursuing the claim by the collection agency has failed to resolve it and
therefore legal processes are invoked to pursue the claim through the courts.
organization.commercialCollectionClaims.filings.isClaimDisput
ed[boolean] e.g.: true
When "true", it indicates that the claim has been contested by the debtor.
organization.commercialCollectionClaims.filings.isForeign [boolean] e.g.: true
When "true", indicates that the claim has originated from a creditor located in a different country to that of
the subject.
When "false", this indicates that the creditor is in the same country as that of the subject; however as this
is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent this fact.

organization.financingEvents [object]
The details about the events that have occurred and directly affect the entity's finances (e.g., the means by
which money is obtained by the entity, financial securities that have been filed that affect the entity).
Note: Only latest 100 events included
organization.financingEvents.hasFinancingEvents [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has at least one unsatisfied funding instrument such as a charge or
mortgage recorded against it.
organization.financingEvents.hasOpenFinancingEvents [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the entity is associated with any open financing events.
- If true, entity is associated with at least one open financing event.
- If false, entity is not associated with an open financing event.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.financingEvents.hasSecuredFilings [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization has offered assets as collateral in order to obtain additional funding or
financial aid such as charges/mortgages or equivalent.
organization.financingEvents.hasOpenSecuredFilings [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the entity is associated with any open secured filings such as secured
charges/mortgages pledging's.


===== PAGE 291 =====

- If true, the entity is associated with at least one open secured filing.
- If false the entity is not associated with any open secured filing.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.financingEvents.hasLetterOfLiability [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates if this entity is associated with a letter of liability event where the entity is an issuer or subscriber.
- If true, the entity is an issuer or subscriber of a letter of liability.
- If false, the entity is not an issuer or subscriber of a letter of liability.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.financingEvents.hasOpenLetterOfLiability [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether this entity is associated with an open letter of liability event where the subject is an
issuer or subscriber.
- If true, this entity is associated with an open letter of liability.
- If false, this entity is not associated with an open letter of liability.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.financingEvents.hasRemovedLetterOfLiability [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the entity has a removed a Letter of Agreement.
- If true, a removed letter exists.
- if false, a removed letter does not exist.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.financingEvents.hasLetterOfAgreement [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the entity has a Letter of Agreement.
- If true, a letter exists.
- if false, a letter does not exist.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.

The details about financing agreements that have been filed under the Personal Property Security Act.

ount[integer] e.g.: 2
The total number of events of the type covered by this summary

brand new item.

When set to "true", this indicates that the Financing Event has been satisfied, i.e., this is historical
information.
When set to "false", this indicates that the Financing Event is still outstanding, i.e., this is current
information; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to
represent this fact.

organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.
hasWholeBusinessSecured[boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the charge is secured against all of the entity's tangible and intangible assets. The
intangible assets would have value if the entity was sold as a going concern; the intangible assets would
have no value if the entity liquidated.
- If true, the whole business is used to secure the charge.
- If false, the whole business is not used to secure the charge.
organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.
isSecuredOnAllAssets[boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether all of the entity's assets have been used to secure this financing event.
- If true, all the entity's assets have been used to secure this financing event.
- If false, not all the entity's assets have been used to secure this financing event.
organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.
isStopD[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true", this indicates that D&B should not fabricate or supply this Financing Event in products
and services. Note: One exception to this business rule is the U.S. Public Records report which would
disregard this indicator setting.
When set to "false", this indicates that D&B can fabricate or supply this Financing Event in products and
services; however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent
this fact.
organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.
originalFilingDate[string] e.g.: 2017-10-30
The date of the initial filing of the event.
organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.
originalFilingReference[string] e.g.: CaseNumber123
An identifier assigned by a registry or similar body to identify a specific Financing Event e.g.; the filing
reference of a secured charge.

Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,

===== PAGE 303 =====

Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.
rolePlayers.positions[array (object)]
Records information of several different positions the party involved in this Financing Event holds within
the organization. Describes the official roles played by the individual in a business in a standardized coded
format. E.g. Financial Director, Finance Director and Director of Finance would all map to the same code.
Specific textual titles for this party can also be stored as additional Vanity Titles.
organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.
rolePlayers.positions.description[string] e.g.: Senior Consultant
Text defining the position that this role player holds within the organization; e.g., Financial Director,
Managing Director, Sales Director, Operations Manager.
organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.
rolePlayers.positions.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 28137
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet defining the position that this role player holds within the
organization; e.g., Financial Director, Managing Director, Sales Director, Operations Manager.
Refer to Reference code table "5 [Position] & 198 [Employee Position]" for all possible values.
organization.financingEvents.financingStatementFilings.filings.

the role player.

equate to Financial Director but the Vanity Title might be 'Senior Director of Finance'.

organization.financingEvents.mortgagesAndCharges [object]
The details about events that are adjudged a conveyance of legal interest in property as security or
borrowing secured against both the fixed and floating assets of the entity. Holders of a general charge

===== PAGE 307 =====

have call on assets behind only debenture holders in the event of company liquidation.
(Available for UK and Ireland only.)

organization.financingEvents.mortgagesAndCharges.filings.en
dIndicator[boolean] e.g.: true
When "true", this indicates that the Financing Event has been satisfied, i.e., this is historical information.
When "false", this indicates that the Financing Event is still outstanding, i.e., this is current information;
however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent this fact.

organization.financingEvents.mortgagesAndCharges.filings.ha
sWholeBusinessSecured[boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the charge is secured against all of the entity's tangible and intangible assets. The
intangible assets would have value if the entity was sold as a going concern; the intangible assets would
have no value if the entity liquidated.
- If true, the whole business is used to secure the charge.
- If false, the whole business is not used to secure the charge.
organization.financingEvents.mortgagesAndCharges.filings.is
SecuredOnAllAssets[boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether all of the entity's assets have been used to secure this financing event.
- If true, all the entity's assets have been used to secure this financing event.
- If false, not all the entity's assets have been used to secure this financing event.
organization.financingEvents.mortgagesAndCharges.filings.ori
ginalFilingDate[string] e.g.: 2017-10-30
The date of the initial filing of the event.

organization.financingEvents.mortgagesAndCharges.filings.rol
ePlayers.hasEnded[boolean] e.g.: true
When "true", this indicates that the Financing Event has been satisfied, i.e., this is historical information.
When "false", this indicates that the Financing Event is still outstanding, i.e., this is current information;
however as this is the assumed condition there is no requirement to create this tag to represent this fact.

organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability [object]

ability[object]

take over its liabilities.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings[array (object)]
The details on each of the events where the entity has issued a formal declaration to enable other entities
to take over its liabilities.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.effectiveDate[string] e.g.: 2017-11-30
The date upon which a financial instrument will come into effect (e.g., a Letter of Liability may be filed with
an Event Date of 2005-11-15 to come into effect from 2006-01-01 until 2006-12-31)
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.filingDate[string] e.g.: 2017-10-15
The date on which the subscriber entity submitted a letter to take over the liabilities of the subject entity.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.lastRenewalDate[string] e.g.: 2018-06-30
The date when the financial instrument was last renewed or confirmed (e.g., the date when the Letter of
Liability Subscriber received an acceptance letter from the Letter of Liability Issuer).
For example, in the Netherlands it is required by law that the Letter of Liability Issuer must confirm yearly
in writing that the liability is maintained; hence, the Letter of Liability Issuer is not required to publish its
individual balance sheet.

defendant).
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.rolePlayerType.dnbCode[integer] e.g.: 302
A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet to identify the function played by this party in the event.
Refer to Reference code table "10 [Role Player Type]" for all possible values.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.standardRating[object]
The most current Standard Dun & Bradstreet Rating assigned to this entity.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.standardRating.financialStrength[string] e.g.: 3A
The overall size of the entity from a financial perspective. It may be based on the net worth or issued
capital of the entity; the higher the amount, the larger the entity is considered to be.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.standardRating.riskSegment[string] e.g.: 4
Creditworthiness of the entity in terms of its overall financial condition or risk to creditors.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.standardRating.scoreDate[string] e.g.: 2010-03-14
The date when the score was assigned or last changed. Scores are continuously monitored and
recalculated as any input variables changes. In the event that the score could not be assigned on the
entity, this is the date when the reason was recorded explaining why the score was not assigned. Format:
YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.
Note: In some markets, the date is not changed unless there is a score change in order to avoid
unnecessary notifications. But in others, the score date changes even though the score does not change
after the market recalculates the score.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.startDate[string] e.g.: 2017-10-15
The date on which the subscriber entity submitted a letter to take over the liabilities of the subject entity.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.telephone[object]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.isdCode[string] e.g.: 1
A series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in another Country, it is
comprised of an International Dialing Prefix followed by the Country Code. These are also referred to as
Country Calling Code or Country Dial-In Code.

===== PAGE 324 =====

organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.issuedLetterOfLi
ability.filings.rolePlayers.telephone.telephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

ability.filings.rolePlayers.textEntry[array (object)]
The details of data elements regarding the legal event filing which cannot be recorded in the other fields.

Text entry type to qualify the information recorded in the text entries.

Liability Subscriber received an acceptance letter from the Letter of Liability Issuer).
For example, in the Netherlands it is required by law that the Letter of Liability Issuer must confirm yearly
in writing that the liability is maintained; hence, the Letter of Liability Issuer is not required to publish its
individual balance sheet.

organization.financingEvents.letterOfLiability.subscribedToLett
erOfLiability.filings.rolePlayers.address.postalCode[string] e.g.: 941109999
The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

organization.financingEvents.otherFinancingEvents.filings.has
WholeBusinessSecured[boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates whether the charge is secured against all of the entity's tangible and intangible assets. The
intangible assets would have value if the entity was sold as a going concern; the intangible assets would
have no value if the entity liquidated.
- If true, the whole business is used to secure the charge.
- If false, the whole business is not used to secure the charge.

- If true, all the entity's assets have been used to secure this financing event.
- If false, not all the entity's assets have been used to secure this financing event.

organization.significantEvents [object]
The details about key events that may affect the entity. This may include such things as natural disasters
(e.g., floods, hurricane), accidents (e.g., chemical spillage), major events at the business (e.g., change of
control, business interruption, awarded contract), societal events (e.g., war, civil disturbance).
organization.significantEvents.hasSignificantEvents [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates an event likely to impact the organization including but not limited to strategy, operations,
finances or reputation.
organization.significantEvents.hasOperationalEvents [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates that an organization is changing how it operates or is structured. This may include, but is not
limited to, name changes, change in management, change of control and address changes.
organization.significantEvents.hasDisastrousEvents [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates if special events regarded as disasters (e.g., fire, hurricane) exist in the Dun & Bradstreet
database for this subject.
- If true, there are events for this entity.
- If false, there are no such events for this entity.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.significantEvents.hasBurglaryOccured [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates if special events related to burglary or theft exist in the Dun & Bradstreet database for this
subject.
- If true, there are events for this entity.
- If false, there are no such events for this entity.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.

===== PAGE 345 =====

organization.significantEvents.hasFireOccurred [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates if special events related to fire exist in the Dun & Bradstreet database for this subject.
- If true, there are events for this entity.
- If false, there are no such events for this entity.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.significantEvents.hasBusinessDiscontinued [boolean] e.g.: false
DO NOT USE. This element is in the process of being deprecated. To determine operating status, check
organization.dunsControlStatus.operatingStatus
organization.significantEvents.hasNameChange [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates if special events related to company name changes exist in the Dun & Bradstreet database for
this subject.
- If true, there are events for this entity.
- If false, there are no such events for this entity.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.significantEvents.hasPartnerChange [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates if special events related to partner change exist in the Dun & Bradstreet database for this
subject.
- If true, there are events for this entity.
- If false, there are no such events for this entity.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.significantEvents.hasCEOChange [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates if special events related to senior executive changes exist in the Dun & Bradstreet database for
this subject.
- If true, there are events for this entity.
- If false, there are no such events for this entity.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.significantEvents.hasControlChange [boolean] e.g.: false
Indicates if special events related to change of management control exist in the Dun & Bradstreet
database for this subject.
- If true, there are events for this entity.
- If false, there are no such events for this entity.
- null; when Dun & Bradstreet is not aware of this fact.
organization.significantEvents.events [array (object)]

===== PAGE 346 =====

The details about key events that may affect the entity. It covers such things as natural disasters (e.g.,
floods, hurricane), accidents (e.g., chemical spillage), major events at the business (e.g., change of
control, business interruption, awarded contract), and societal events (e.g., war, civil disturbance).

Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

trading on this date.

organization.awards [object]
Records information about the data on government contracts, contract
vehicles, grants, loans, and other types of awards issued by the federal
government.
organization.awards.hasContracts [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if there are any contracts awarded to the subject, as per the information received by Dun &
Bradstreet.
- if true; contracts have been awarded

===== PAGE 357 =====

- if false; contracts are not available.
organization.awards.hasLoans [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if there are any loans awarded to the subject, as per the information received by Dun &
Bradstreet.
- if true; loans have been awarded
- if false; loans are not available.
organization.awards.hasDebts [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if there are any debts associated with the subject, as per the information received by Dun &
Bradstreet.
- if true; debts are recorded
- if false; debts are not recorded
organization.awards.hasGrants [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if there are any grants awarded to the subject, as per the information received by Dun &
Bradstreet.
- if true; grants have been awarded
- if false; grants are not available.
organization.awards.hasOpenContracts [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if there are any open contracts awarded to the subject, as per the information received by Dun &
Bradstreet.
- if true; open contracts have been awarded
- if false; open contracts are not available.
organization.awards.hasOpenLoans [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if there are any open loans awarded to the subject, as per the information received by Dun &
Bradstreet.
- if true; open loans have been awarded
- if false; open loans are not available.
organization.awards.hasOpenDebts [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if there are any open debts associated with the subject, as per the information received by Dun &
Bradstreet.
- if true; open debts are recorded
- if false; open debts are not recorded

===== PAGE 358 =====

organization.awards.hasOpenGrants [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if there are any open grants awarded to the subject, as per the information received by Dun &
Bradstreet.
- if true; open grants have been awarded
- if false; open grants are not available.
organization.awards.obligatedContractsAmount [object]
Records the sum of monetary amounts contained in a contract that this party agreed to when they signed
and are now legally obligated to pay.
organization.awards.obligatedContractsAmount.value [number] e.g.: 250000
The sum of monetary amounts contained in a contract that this party agreed to when they signed and are
now legally obligated to pay.
organization.awards.currentContractsAmount [object]
Records the sum of monetary figures about the changes (from this transaction only) to the current contract
value (i.e., the base contract and any options that have been exercised).
organization.awards.currentContractsAmount.value [number] e.g.: 250000
The sum of monetary figures about the changes (from this transaction only) to the current contract value
(i.e., the base contract and any options that have been exercised).
organization.awards.totalOpenContractsCount [integer] e.g.: 12
The number of open contracts awarded to the subject.
organization.awards.totalOpenContractsAmount [object]
Records the monetary amount of open contracts awarded to the subject.
organization.awards.totalOpenContractsAmount.value [number] e.g.: 250500.5
The monetary value of the open contracts.

Records the sum of changes (from this transaction only) to the potential contract value (i.e., the base
contract and any exercised or unexercised options).
organization.awards.totalContractsAmount.value [number] e.g.: 250000
The monetary sum of changes (from this transaction only) to the potential contract value (i.e., the base
contract and any exercised or unexercised options).

The number of open loans awarded to the subject.

Records the monetary amount of open loans awarded to the subject.

organization.awards.contracts [array (object)]
Records information about the written agreements made between the Federal government and one or
more role players participating in a financing event; e.g., lease, sale, rental, refinancing. It is the amount of
money that the U.S. federal government owes to its creditors.
organization.awards.contracts.awardID [string] e.g.: asst_non_w912
The unique key for the award.

GRANT (B), DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER
NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C).

organization.awards.contracts.usaSpendingURL [string] e.g.:
https://www.usaspending.gov/#/award/CONT_AWD_47QSCC20F1Y47_4732_GS23FGA026_4732/
A Web Page Address is a telecommunication address used by a USA Spending for this award. This can
be the address of a computer or a document on the Internet that consists of the identifier of a computer,
using a host name or Internet Protocol (IP) address (as www.dnb.com), and optionally an explicit file
location. The communications protocol followed by a colon and two slashes (http://) is not included in the
Web Page address.

ate[string] e.g.: 2020-09-18
The date when this award information was last updated int the USA Spending web page.
organization.awards.contracts.transactions [array (object)]

===== PAGE 365 =====

Award Transaction entity records information about the data on each financial assistance transaction
record and facilitate record lookup, correction, and deletion.
organization.awards.contracts.transactions.uniqueKey [string] e.g.: 3600_-NONE-_36C24919D0057_P00002_-NONE-_-NONE-
System-generated database key used to uniquely identify each financial assistance transaction record and
facilitate record lookup, correction, and deletion. A concatenation of
AwardModificationAmendmentNumber, AwardingSubTierAgencyCode, FAIN, and URI with a single
underscore ('_') character inserted in between each. If a field is blank, it is recorded as "- none-".
organization.awards.contracts.recipients [array (object)]
Award Recipient entity records information regarding the legal entity which receives the award/assistance
from the government.
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.name [string] e.g.: BUSINESS COUNCIL FOR INTERNATIONAL UNDERSTANDING, INC., THE
The name of the awardee or recipient that relates to the unique identifier. For U.S. based companies, this
name is what the business ordinarily files in formation documents with individual states (when required).
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.tradeStyleName [string] e.g.: CBRE HEERY
The name of the awardee or recipient that relates to the unique identifier. For U.S. based companies, this
name is what the business ordinarily files in formation documents with individual states (when required).
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.duns [string] e.g.: 804735132
The D-U-N-S® Number, a proprietary organizational identifier owned and managed by Dun & Bradstreet
Inc, provides unique identification of a subject organization, in accordance with the Data Universal
Numbering System (D-U-N-S®).
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.cageCode [string] e.g.: CAGE123
A Code describes Commercial And Government Entity Code of the contractor. Used as a key to SAM.
Maps to the DUNS.
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.telephone [array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.telephone.telephone
Number[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.fax [array (object)]
The details of the facsimile information used for data communication with the entity.

===== PAGE 366 =====

organization.awards.contracts.recipients.fax.faxNumber [string] e.g.: 6505550001
A sequence of digits used for facsimile communication with the entity.
This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

organization.awards.contracts.recipients.address.postalCode [string] e.g.: 941109999
The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.address.postalCode
Extension[string] e.g.: 9999

the Postal Code.

===== PAGE 369 =====

organization.awards.contracts.recipients.highlyCompensated
Officers.totalCompensationAmount[object]
Records the cash and noncash dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock
appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.
organization.awards.contracts.recipients.highlyCompensated
Officers.totalCompensationAmount.value[number] e.g.: 250000
The cash and noncash US dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock
appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

organization.awards.contracts.performanceLocations.address.

The shortened name of the geographical area for this address of the organization. For example NJ for the
US State New Jersey within Country United States.

organization.awards.contracts.performanceLocations.address.
postalCode[string] e.g.: 941109999
The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

organization.awards.contracts.actions [array (object)]
Records information about the action taken under the award; the amount of money granted or
de-obligated, relevant dates and the type of action.

Records the changes made to the Federal prime award.

A code which specifies the changes made to the Federal prime award. e.g., . C for Revision, A for New.

The text specifying the business area.

transaction.

currency[string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).

organization.awards.contracts.actions.expirationDate [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
The current date on which, for the award referred to by the action being reported, awardee effort

===== PAGE 374 =====

completes or the award is otherwise ended. Administrative actions related to this award may continue to
occur after this date. This date does not apply to procurement indefinite delivery vehicles under which
definitive orders may be awarded.
organization.awards.contracts.actions.potentialExpirationDate [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
A date describes that for procurement, the date on which, for the award referred to by the action being
reported if all potential pre-determined or prenegotiated options were exercised, awardee effort is
completed or the award is otherwise ended. Administrative actions related to this award may continue to
occur after this date. This date does not apply to procurement indefinite delivery vehicles under which
definitive orders may be awarded.
organization.awards.contracts.actions.deliveryVehicleOrderEx
pirationDate[string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
A Date describes that for procurement, the date on which, for the award referred to by the action being
reported, no additional orders referring to it may be placed. This date applies only to procurement indefinite
delivery vehicles (such as indefinite delivery contracts or blanket purchase agreements). Administrative
actions related to this award may continue to occur after this date. The period of performance end dates
for procurement orders issued under the indefinite delivery vehicle may extend beyond this date.
organization.awards.contracts.actions.actionsCount [integer] e.g.: 150
A number input by the agency that identifies number of actions that are reported in one modification.
organization.awards.contracts.actions.actionLatestDate [string] e.g.: 2022-10-19
The latest date the for the award action.
organization.awards.contracts.actions.actionLatestFiscalYear [string] e.g.: 2022
The fiscal year of the latest action action date. Note that the Federal fiscal year begins on October 1 and
ends on September 30, thus October 1, 2018 is the first day of the 2019 fiscal year.

organization.awards.contracts.subAwards.recipients.telephon
e[array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.awards.contracts.subAwards.recipients.telephon
e.telephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

mber[string] e.g.: 6505550001

===== PAGE 380 =====

mpensatedOfficers.totalCompensationAmount Records the cash and noncash dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock
appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

mpensatedOfficers.totalCompensationAmount.value[number] e.g.: 250000
The cash and noncash US dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock
appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

organization.awards.contracts.subAwards.subAwardPrimeAw
ardDetail[array (object)]

(PO), Delivery Orders (DO), Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPA) Calls and Definitive Contracts.

A code describes that the type of award being entered by this transaction. Types of awards include

Contracts.

Government-Wide Acquisition Contract (GWAC), Multi-Agency Contract, Other Indefinite Delivery Contract
(IDC), Federal Supply Schedule (FSS), Basic Ordering Agreement (BOA), and Blanket Purchase
Agreements (BPA).

Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPA).

Delivery Contract (IDC), Federal Supply Schedule (FSS), Basic Ordering Agreement (BOA), and Blanket
Purchase Agreements (BPA).

organization.awards.contracts.performanceBasedServiceAcqu
isition[object]
Records whether the contract action is a PBA of services as defined by FAR 37.601. A PBSA.
organization.awards.contracts.performanceBasedServiceAcqu [string] e.g.: Y

===== PAGE 391 =====

isition.code A code describes whether the contract action is a PBA of services as defined by FAR 37.601. A PBSA: a.
Describes the requirements in terms of results required rather than the methods of performance of the
work b. Uses measurable performance standards (i. e. terms of quality, timelines, quantity etc.) and quality
assurance surveillance plans (refer to 46.103(a) and 46.401(a)) c. Specifies procedures for reductions of
fee or for reductions to the price of a fixed-price contract when services are not performed or do not meet
contract requirements (refer to 46.407) d. Includes performance incentives where applicable.
organization.awards.contracts.performanceBasedServiceAcqu
isition.description[string] e.g.: YES - SERVICE WHERE PBA IS USED.
Text describes whether the contract action is a PBA of services as defined by FAR 37.601. A PBSA: a.
Describes the requirements in terms of results required rather than the methods of performance of the
work b. Uses measurable performance standards (i. e. terms of quality, timelines, quantity etc.) and quality
assurance surveillance plans (refer to 46.103(a) and 46.401(a)) c. Specifies procedures for reductions of
fee or for reductions to the price of a fixed-price contract when services are not performed or do not meet
contract requirements (refer to 46.407) d. Includes performance incentives where applicable.

code[string] e.g.: N

report purchase card purchases.

organization.awards.contracts.multiYearContract [object]

organization.awards.contracts.multiYearContract.code [string] e.g.: Y
A code describes the contract for the purchase of supplies or services for more than 1, but not more than
5, program years. Such contracts are issued under specific congressional authority for specific programs.
organization.awards.contracts.multiYearContract.description [string] e.g.: YES
Text describes the contract for the purchase of supplies or services for more than 1, but not more than 5,
program years. Such contracts are issued under specific congressional authority for specific programs. A
multiyear contract may provide that performance under the contract during the second and subsequent
years of the contract is contingent upon the appropriation of funds, and (if it does so provide) may provide
for a cancellation payment to be made to the contractor if appropriations are not made.
organization.awards.contracts.transactionNumber [integer] e.g.: 0

===== PAGE 392 =====

A Number is the "Tie" Breaker for legal, unique transactions that would otherwise have the same key.
organization.awards.contracts.parentContractID [string] e.g.: GS00P10BQD0004

Schedule).
organization.awards.contracts.parentContractModificationNu
mber[string] e.g.: Mod123
A Number describes when reporting orders under Indefinite Delivery Vehicles (IDV) such as a GWAC,
IDC, FSS, BOA, or BPA, report the Modification Number along with Procurement Instrument Identifier
(Contract Number or Agreement Number) of the IDV. For the initial load of a BPA under a FSS, this is the
FSS contract number. Note: BOAs and BPAs are with industry and not with other Federal Agencies.

ue[string] e.g.: 250000.00

contract value (i.e., the base contract and any options that have been exercised).
organization.awards.contracts.currentTotalAmount [object]
Records total amount obligated to date on an award. For a contract, this amount includes the base and
exercised options.
organization.awards.contracts.currentTotalAmount.value [string] e.g.: 250000.00
A monetary figure in US Dollars that represents the total amount obligated to date on an award. For a
contract, this amount includes the base and exercised options.
organization.awards.contracts.baseAndAllOptionsAmount [object]
Records the change (from this transaction only) to the potential contract value (i.e., the base contract and
any exercised or unexercised options).

e[string] e.g.: 250000.00

contract value (i.e., the base contract and any exercised or unexercised options).

organization.awards.contracts.potentialTotalContractAmount.v
alue[string] e.g.: 250000.00

organization.awards.contracts.solicitationID [string] e.g.: W912HN09R0060
A Identifier used to link transactions in FPDS-NG to solicitation information.

===== PAGE 393 =====

organization.awards.contracts.solicitationDate [string] e.g.: 2020-06-08
The date that specifies when the solicitation was issued.
organization.awards.contracts.isIDVRecord [boolean] e.g.: false
An Indicator describes whether the record was pulled from the award Atom feed or the IDV (Indefinite
Delivery Vehicle) Atom Feed provided by FPDS. When "true", it means that the Contract is Indefinite
Delivery Vehicle. When "false" it means that the Contract is not an Indefinite Delivery Vehicle.
organization.awards.contracts.isMultipleIDV [boolean] e.g.: true
An Indicator Indicates whether the contract is one of many that resulted from a single solicitation, all of the
contracts are for the same or similar items, and contracting officers are required to compare their
requirements with the offerings under more than one contract or are required to acquire the requirement
competitively among the awardees. BPA ""Multiple or Single Award IDV"" value does not pull the ""Multiple
or Single Award IDV"" value of the referenced FSS to the BPA. The ""Multiple or Single Award IDV"" value
shall be required and selected by the user for all BPA bases created. When "true", it means that the
Multiple Indefinite Delivery Vehicle Indicator is multiple. When "false", it means that the Multiple Indefinite
Delivery Vehicle Indicator is single.
organization.awards.contracts.priceDifferencePercentage [number] e.g.: 12.5
A Number describes that percent difference between the award price and the lowest priced offer from a
responsive, responsible non-HUBZone or non-SDB.
organization.awards.contracts.programShortName [string] e.g.: Prog1
Text describes the short name or title used for a GWAC or other contracting program. Examples include
COMMITS, ITOPS, SEWP.
organization.awards.contracts.majorProgramDescription [string] e.g.: JANSAN FEDERAL STRATEGIC SOURCING INITIATIVE
Text describes the agency determined code for a major program within the agency. For an Indefinite
Delivery Vehicle, this may be the name of a GWAC (e.g., ITOPS or COMMITS).
organization.awards.contracts.isParentMultipleIDV [boolean] e.g.: true
An Indicator indicates whether the contract of the referenced IDV is one of many that resulted from a
single solicitation, all of the contracts are for the same or similar items, and contracting officers are
required to compare their requirements with the offerings under more than one contract or are required to
acquire the requirement competitively among the awardees. BPA "Multiple or Single Award IDV" value
does not pull the "Multiple or Single Award IDV" value of the referenced FSS to the BPA. The "Multiple or
Single Award IDV" value shall be required and selected by the user for all BPA bases created. When
"true", it means that the multiple parent contract. When "false", it means that the Contract is not a multiple
parent contract .
organization.awards.contracts.contractProjectTitle [string] e.g.: Title1
The title of the contract.
organization.awards.contracts.disasterEmergencyFundDescri [string] e.g.: None

===== PAGE 394 =====

ption Text that describes the type of disaster related funding and is represented as a Letter.

organization.awards.contracts.socioEconomicClassification [object]
Records information about categorizing an organization into a type of business grouping based upon that
organization's ability to meet the specific rules/guidelines established by the entities responsible for
monitoring the individual programs in which the organization participates; e.g., Disabled Veteran Business
Enterprise, Small Disadvantaged Business, Woman Business Enterprise. For example, a business that is
both Disabled Owned and Veteran Owned could have a classification of Service Disabled Veteran.
organization.awards.contracts.socioEconomicClassification.dn
bCode[integer] e.g.: 9099
A D&B code that provides a method for categorizing an organization into a type of business grouping
based upon that organization's ability to meet the specific rules/guidelines established by the entities
responsible for monitoring the individual programs in which the organization participates; e.g., Disabled
Veteran Business Enterprise, Small Disadvantaged Business, Woman Business Enterprise. For example,
a business that is both Disabled Owned and Veteran Owned could have a classification of Service
Disabled Veteran.
Refer to Reference code table "272 [Socio Economic Classification] & 181 [Socio Economic Type] & 838
[Contract Socio Economic Classification Type]" for all possible values.
organization.awards.contracts.socioEconomicClassification.de
scription[string] e.g.: Female owned
Text that provides a method for categorizing an organization into a type of business grouping based upon
that organization's ability to meet the specific rules/guidelines established by the entities responsible for
monitoring the individual programs in which the organization participates; e.g., Disabled Veteran Business
Enterprise, Small Disadvantaged Business, Woman Business Enterprise. For example, a business that is
both Disabled Owned and Veteran Owned could have a classification of Service Disabled Veteran.

organization.awards.contracts.requisitions.contractBundlingTy
pe[object]
Records information on "Bundling" or "bundled contract".

===== PAGE 397 =====

organization.awards.contracts.requisitions.contractBundlingTy
pe.code[string] e.g.: H
A Code describes "Bundling" or "bundled contract" (1) Means the consolidating or combining of two or
more requirements for supplies or services, previously provided or performed under separate smaller
contracts, into a solicitation for a single contract, a multiple-award contract, a task order or delivery order
that is likely to be unsuitable for award to a small business concern(but may be suitable for award to a
small business with a Small Business Teaming Arrangement) due to-(i) The diversity, size, or specialized
nature of the elements of the performance specified; (ii) The aggregate dollar value of the anticipated
award; (iii) The geographical dispersion of the contract performance sites; or (iv) Any combination of the
factors described in paragraphs (1)(i), (ii), and (iii) of this definition. (2) "Separate smaller contract" as used
in this definition, means a contract that has been performed by one or more small business concerns or
that was suitable for award to one or more small business concerns.
organization.awards.contracts.requisitions.contractBundlingTy
pe.description[string] e.g.: NOT BUNDLED
A Text describes "Bundling" or "bundled contract".
organization.awards.contracts.requisitions.epaDesignatedPro
duct[object]
Records information that the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA), Section 6002, and
Executive Order 13101 require the purchase of Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) -designated
products with a required minimum recovered material content as described in an agency's Affirmative
Procurement Program (APP).
organization.awards.contracts.requisitions.epaDesignatedPro
duct.code[string] e.g.: E
A Code describes that the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA), Section 6002, and
Executive Order 13101 require the purchase of Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) -designated
products with a required minimum recovered material content as described in an agency's Affirmative
Procurement Program (APP). This list of EPA-designated products is available at http://www.epa.gov/cpg.
This requirement applies to all contracts that require EPA-designated products.
organization.awards.contracts.requisitions.epaDesignatedPro
duct.description[string] e.g.: NOT REQUIRED
A Text describes that the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA), Section 6002, and Executive
Order 13101 require the purchase of Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) -designated products with a
required minimum recovered material content as described in an agency's Affirmative Procurement
Program (APP).
organization.awards.contracts.requisitions.consolidatedContra
ct[object]
Records information that the Consolidation, "consolidation of contract requirements," "consolidated
contract," or "consolidated requirement".
organization.awards.contracts.requisitions.consolidatedContra
ct.code[string] e.g.: D
A Code describes that the Consolidation, "consolidation of contract requirements," "consolidated contract,"
or "consolidated requirement"- (1) Means a solicitation for a single contract, a multiple award contract, a
task order, or a delivery order to satisfy- (i) Two or more requirements of the Federal agency for supplies or
services that have been provided to or performed for the Federal agency under two or more separate
contracts, each of which was lower in cost than the total cost of the contract for which offers are solicited;

===== PAGE 398 =====

or (ii) Requirements of the Federal agency for construction projects to be performed at two or more
discrete sites. (2) "Separate contract" as used in this definition, means a contract that has been performed
by any business, including small and other than small business concerns.

ct.description[string] e.g.: NOT CONSOLIDATED
A Text describes that the Consolidation, "consolidation of contract requirements," "consolidated contract,"
or "consolidated requirement".

as listed in the program and financing schedules of the annual budget of the U.S. government.
organization.awards.grants [array (object)]

money that the U.S. federal government owes to its creditors.

organization.awards.grants.totalNonFederalFundingAmount [object]

urrency[string] e.g.: USD

organization.awards.grants.totalFundingAmount.currency [string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).
organization.awards.grants.totalFaceValueLoanAmount [object]
Records the monetary figure specifying the total face value of the direct loan or loan guarantee.
organization.awards.grants.totalFaceValueLoanAmount.value [number] e.g.: 2500000
The monetary figure specifying the total face value of the direct loan or loan guarantee.

ncy[string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).

Records the estimated long-term total cost to the Government of a direct loan or loan guarantee, or
modification thereof, calculated on a net present value basis, excluding administrative costs.

alue[number] e.g.: 2500000
The estimated long-term total cost to the Government of a direct loan or loan guarantee, or modification

(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).
organization.awards.grants.fundingTreasuryAccountNumber [string] e.g.: 047-X-4534-001
The account number of the treasury funding this award.
organization.awards.grants.fundingFederalAccountNumber [string] e.g.: 047-4534
The account number of the federal funding this award.
organization.awards.grants.awardDescription [string] e.g.: BATTERIES,ALKALINE,AAA,12/PK
A brief description of the purpose of the award.
organization.awards.grants.usaSpendingURL [string] e.g.:
https://www.usaspending.gov/#/award/CONT_AWD_47QSCC20F1Y47_4732_GS23FGA026_4732/
A Web Page Address is a telecommunication address used by a USA Spending for this award. This can
be the address of a computer or a document on the Internet that consists of the identifier of a computer,
using a host name or Internet Protocol (IP) address (as www.dnb.com), and optionally an explicit file
location. The communications protocol followed by a colon and two slashes (http://) is not included in the
Web Page address.
organization.awards.grants.usaSpendingURLModificationDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-18
The date when this award information was last updated int the USA Spending web page.
organization.awards.grants.transactions [array (object)]
Award Transaction entity records information about the data on each financial assistance transaction
record and facilitate record lookup, correction, and deletion.
organization.awards.grants.transactions.uniqueKey [string] e.g.: 3600_-NONE-_36C24919D0057_P00002_-NONE-_-NONE-
System-generated database key used to uniquely identify each financial assistance transaction record and
facilitate record lookup, correction, and deletion. A concatenation of

===== PAGE 406 =====

AwardModificationAmendmentNumber, AwardingSubTierAgencyCode, FAIN, and URI with a single
underscore ('_') character inserted in between each. If a field is blank, it is recorded as "- none-".
organization.awards.grants.recipients [array (object)]
Award Recipient entity records information regarding the legal entity which receives the award/assistance
from the government.
organization.awards.grants.recipients.name [string] e.g.: BUSINESS COUNCIL FOR INTERNATIONAL UNDERSTANDING, INC., THE
The name of the awardee or recipient that relates to the unique identifier. For U.S. based companies, this
name is what the business ordinarily files in formation documents with individual states (when required).
organization.awards.grants.recipients.tradeStyleName [string] e.g.: CBRE HEERY
The name of the awardee or recipient that relates to the unique identifier. For U.S. based companies, this
name is what the business ordinarily files in formation documents with individual states (when required).
organization.awards.grants.recipients.duns [string] e.g.: 804735132
The D-U-N-S® Number, a proprietary organizational identifier owned and managed by Dun & Bradstreet
Inc, provides unique identification of a subject organization, in accordance with the Data Universal
Numbering System (D-U-N-S®).
organization.awards.grants.recipients.cageCode [string] e.g.: CAGE123
A Code describes Commercial And Government Entity Code of the contractor. Used as a key to SAM.
Maps to the DUNS.
organization.awards.grants.recipients.telephone [array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.awards.grants.recipients.telephone.telephoneNu
mber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.
organization.awards.grants.recipients.fax [array (object)]
The details of the facsimile information used for data communication with the entity.
organization.awards.grants.recipients.fax.faxNumber [string] e.g.: 6505550001
A sequence of digits used for facsimile communication with the entity.
This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

organization.awards.grants.recipients.address.postalCode [string] e.g.: 941109999
The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

organization.awards.grants.recipients.highlyCompensatedOffi
cers[array (object)]

"Executives." "Executive" means officers, managing partners, or any other employees in the
sub-awardee's management positions.

cers.name[string] e.g.: NANCY KIPPER

means officers, managing partners, or any other employees in the sub awardee's management positions.
organization.awards.grants.recipients.highlyCompensatedOffi
cers.totalCompensationAmount[object]
Records the cash and noncash dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock

===== PAGE 410 =====

appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.
organization.awards.grants.recipients.highlyCompensatedOffi
cers.totalCompensationAmount.value[number] e.g.: 250000
The cash and noncash dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated “Executives”
during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more information see 17
CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock appreciation rights,
earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above market earnings
on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.
organization.awards.grants.recipients.highlyCompensatedOffi
cers.sequence[integer] e.g.: 1
The number which specifies the Highly Compensated Officer., 1, 2 3 etc.
