organization.awards.grants.actions.effectiveDate [string] e.g.: 2019-07-22
The date on which, for the award referred to by the action being reported, awardee effort begins or the
award is otherwise effective.
organization.awards.grants.actions.expirationDate [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
The current date on which, for the award referred to by the action being reported, awardee effort
completes or the award is otherwise ended. Administrative actions related to this award may continue to
occur after this date. This date does not apply to procurement indefinite delivery vehicles under which
definitive orders may be awarded.

===== PAGE 415 =====

organization.awards.grants.actions.potentialExpirationDate [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
A date describes that for procurement, the date on which, for the award referred to by the action being
reported if all potential pre-determined or prenegotiated options were exercised, awardee effort is
completed or the award is otherwise ended. Administrative actions related to this award may continue to
occur after this date. This date does not apply to procurement indefinite delivery vehicles under which
definitive orders may be awarded.
organization.awards.grants.actions.deliveryVehicleOrderExpir
ationDate[string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
A Date describes that for procurement, the date on which, for the award referred to by the action being
reported, no additional orders referring to it may be placed. This date applies only to procurement indefinite
delivery vehicles (such as indefinite delivery contracts or blanket purchase agreements). Administrative
actions related to this award may continue to occur after this date. The period of performance end dates
for procurement orders issued under the indefinite delivery vehicle may extend beyond this date.
organization.awards.grants.actions.actionsCount [integer] e.g.: 150
A number input by the agency that identifies number of actions that are reported in one modification.
organization.awards.grants.actions.actionLatestDate [string] e.g.: 2022-10-19
The latest date the for the award action.
organization.awards.grants.actions.actionLatestFiscalYear [string] e.g.: 2022
The fiscal year of the latest action action date. Note that the Federal fiscal year begins on October 1 and
ends on September 30, thus October 1, 2018 is the first day of the 2019 fiscal year.

sub-contract.

The FFATA Subaward Reporting System (FSRS) Report Period Year for the subaward.

A Web Page Address is a telecommunication address used by a USA Spending for this award.

ficationDate[string] e.g.: 2020-10-07

organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients [array (object)]
Award Recipient entity records information regarding the legal entity which receives the award/assistance
from the government.
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.name [string] e.g.: BUSINESS COUNCIL FOR INTERNATIONAL UNDERSTANDING, INC., THE
The name of the awardee or recipient that relates to the unique identifier. For U.S. based companies, this
name is what the business ordinarily files in formation documents with individual states (when required).
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.tradeStyleN
ame[string] e.g.: CBRE HEERY
The name of the awardee or recipient that relates to the unique identifier. For U.S. based companies, this
name is what the business ordinarily files in formation documents with individual states (when required).
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.duns [string] e.g.: 804735132
The D-U-N-S® Number, a proprietary organizational identifier owned and managed by Dun & Bradstreet
Inc, provides unique identification of a subject organization, in accordance with the Data Universal
Numbering System (D-U-N-S®).
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.cageCode [string] e.g.: CAGE123
A Code describes Commercial And Government Entity Code of the contractor. Used as a key to SAM.
Maps to the DUNS.
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.telephone [array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.telephone.te
lephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.fax [array (object)]
The details of the facsimile information used for data communication with the entity.
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.fax.faxNum
ber[string] e.g.: 6505550001
A sequence of digits used for facsimile communication with the entity.
This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

talCode[string] e.g.: 941109999
The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.highlyComp

sub-awardee's management positions.

organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.highlyComp
ensatedOfficers.totalCompensationAmount[object]
Records the cash and noncash dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock

===== PAGE 421 =====

appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.
organization.awards.grants.subAwards.recipients.highlyComp
ensatedOfficers.totalCompensationAmount.value[number] e.g.: 250000
The cash and noncash US dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock
appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

system that presents obligations by the items or services purchased by the Federal Government. Each
specific object class is defined in OMB Circular A-11 § 83.6.

appropriation account and are unique to each account. A program activity is a specific activity or project,
as listed in the program and financing schedules of the annual budget of the U.S. government.

organization.awards.loans [array (object)]
Records information about the written agreements made between the Federal government and one or
more role players participating in a financing event; e.g., lease, sale, rental, refinancing. It is the amount of
money that the U.S. federal government owes to its creditors.
organization.awards.loans.awardID [string] e.g.: asst_non_w912
The unique key for the award.
organization.awards.loans.assistanceType [object]
Records the kind of assistance provided by the award.
organization.awards.loans.assistanceType.code [string] e.g.: 08
A code which specifies the type of assistance provided by the award, e.g., DIRECT LOAN (E), PROJECT
GRANT (B), DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER
NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C).

transaction.
organization.awards.loans.awardingSubAgency.description [string] e.g.: FEDERAL ACQUISITION SERVICE
The text specifying the name of the name of the level 2 organization that provided the preponderance of
the funds obligated.

Records the name of the level and organization that provided the preponderance of the funds obligated.
organization.awards.loans.awardingOffice.code [string] e.g.: 47QSEA
Identifier of the level and organization that provided the preponderance of the funds obligated.
organization.awards.loans.awardingOffice.description [string] e.g.: GSA/FAS ADMIN SVCS ACQUISITION BR(2
The text specifying the name of the level and organization that provided the preponderance of the funds
obligated.

organization.awards.loans.usaSpendingURL [string] e.g.:
https://www.usaspending.gov/#/award/CONT_AWD_47QSCC20F1Y47_4732_GS23FGA026_4732/
A Web Page Address is a telecommunication address used by a USA Spending for this award. This can
be the address of a computer or a document on the Internet that consists of the identifier of a computer,
using a host name or Internet Protocol (IP) address (as www.dnb.com), and optionally an explicit file
location. The communications protocol followed by a colon and two slashes (http://) is not included in the
Web Page address.
organization.awards.loans.usaSpendingURLModificationDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-18

organization.awards.loans.transactions [array (object)]
Award Transaction entity records information about the data on each financial assistance transaction
record and facilitate record lookup, correction, and deletion.
organization.awards.loans.transactions.uniqueKey [string] e.g.: 3600_-NONE-_36C24919D0057_P00002_-NONE-_-NONE-
System-generated database key used to uniquely identify each financial assistance transaction record and
facilitate record lookup, correction, and deletion. A concatenation of
AwardModificationAmendmentNumber, AwardingSubTierAgencyCode, FAIN, and URI with a single
underscore ('_') character inserted in between each. If a field is blank, it is recorded as "- none-".

organization.awards.loans.recipients.telephone [array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.awards.loans.recipients.telephone.telephoneNum
ber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.
organization.awards.loans.recipients.fax [array (object)]
The details of the facsimile information used for data communication with the entity.
organization.awards.loans.recipients.fax.faxNumber [string] e.g.: 6505550001
A sequence of digits used for facsimile communication with the entity.
This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

The estimated long-term cost to the Government of a direct loan or loan guarantee, or modification thereof,
calculated on a net present value basis, excluding administrative costs.
organization.awards.loans.actions.originalLoanSubsidyAmoun
t.currency[string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).
organization.awards.loans.actions.effectiveDate [string] e.g.: 2019-07-22
The date on which, for the award referred to by the action being reported, awardee effort begins or the
award is otherwise effective.
organization.awards.loans.actions.expirationDate [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
The current date on which, for the award referred to by the action being reported, awardee effort
completes or the award is otherwise ended. Administrative actions related to this award may continue to
occur after this date. This date does not apply to procurement indefinite delivery vehicles under which
definitive orders may be awarded.
organization.awards.loans.actions.potentialExpirationDate [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
A date describes that for procurement, the date on which, for the award referred to by the action being
reported if all potential pre-determined or prenegotiated options were exercised, awardee effort is
completed or the award is otherwise ended. Administrative actions related to this award may continue to

===== PAGE 441 =====

occur after this date. This date does not apply to procurement indefinite delivery vehicles under which
definitive orders may be awarded.
organization.awards.loans.actions.deliveryVehicleOrderExpira
tionDate[string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
A Date describes that for procurement, the date on which, for the award referred to by the action being
reported, no additional orders referring to it may be placed. This date applies only to procurement indefinite
delivery vehicles (such as indefinite delivery contracts or blanket purchase agreements). Administrative
actions related to this award may continue to occur after this date. The period of performance end dates
for procurement orders issued under the indefinite delivery vehicle may extend beyond this date.
organization.awards.loans.actions.actionsCount [integer] e.g.: 150
A number input by the agency that identifies number of actions that are reported in one modification.
organization.awards.loans.actions.actionLatestDate [string] e.g.: 2022-10-19
The latest date the for the award action.
organization.awards.loans.actions.actionLatestFiscalYear [string] e.g.: 2022
The fiscal year of the latest action action date. Note that the Federal fiscal year begins on October 1 and
ends on September 30, thus October 1, 2018 is the first day of the 2019 fiscal year.

contract vehicles, grants, loans, and other types of awards issued by the federal government.

sub-contract.
DO NOT USE: Will always be NULL
Refer to Reference code table "811 [Award Type]" for all possible values.

organization.awards.loans.subAwards.recipients.telephone.tel
ephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.

er[string] e.g.: 6505550001
A sequence of digits used for facsimile communication with the entity.
This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

A identifier of the procurement award under which the specific award is issued (such as a Federal Supply
Schedule).

organization.awards.loans.subAwards.subAwardPrimeAward
Detail.awardFundingObjectClasses[string] e.g.: 20
The text that specifies the object class for this award. Object classes are categories in a classification
system that presents obligations by the items or services purchased by the Federal Government. Each
specific object class is defined in OMB Circular A-11 § 83.6.
organization.awards.loans.subAwards.subAwardPrimeAward
Detail.awardFundingProgramActivities[string] e.g.: 0001
The text that specifies the program funding this award. A program activity is a category within an
appropriation account and are unique to each account. A program activity is a specific activity or project,
as listed in the program and financing schedules of the annual budget of the U.S. government.
organization.awards.loans.subAwards.subAwardPrimeAward
Detail.disasterEmergencyFundDescription[string] e.g.: None

organization.awards.debts [array (object)]
Records information about the written agreements made between the Federal government and one or
more role players participating in a financing event; e.g., lease, sale, rental, refinancing. It is the amount of
money that the U.S. federal government owes to its creditors.
organization.awards.debts.awardID [string] e.g.: asst_non_w912
The unique key for the award.
organization.awards.debts.assistanceType [object]
Records the kind of assistance provided by the award.
organization.awards.debts.assistanceType.code [string] e.g.: 08
A code which specifies the type of assistance provided by the award, e.g., DIRECT LOAN (E), PROJECT
GRANT (B), DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER
NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C).
organization.awards.debts.assistanceType.description [string] e.g.: GUARANTEED/INSURED LOAN (F)
The text specifying the description of the kind of assistance provided by the award.
organization.awards.debts.awardingAgency [object]

Treasury Account Fund Symbol (TAFS).

Symbol (TAFS).

The text specifying the name associated with a department or establishment of the Government as used in
the Treasury Account Fund Symbol (TAFS).

(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).

organization.awards.debts.usaSpendingURL [string] e.g.:
https://www.usaspending.gov/#/award/CONT_AWD_47QSCC20F1Y47_4732_GS23FGA026_4732/
A Web Page Address is a telecommunication address used by a USA Spending for this award. This can
be the address of a computer or a document on the Internet that consists of the identifier of a computer,
using a host name or Internet Protocol (IP) address (as www.dnb.com), and optionally an explicit file
location. The communications protocol followed by a colon and two slashes (http://) is not included in the
Web Page address.
organization.awards.debts.usaSpendingURLModificationDate [string] e.g.: 2020-09-18
The date when this award information was last updated int the USA Spending web page.
organization.awards.debts.transactions [array (object)]
Award Transaction entity records information about the data on each financial assistance transaction
record and facilitate record lookup, correction, and deletion.
organization.awards.debts.transactions.uniqueKey [string] e.g.: 3600_-NONE-_36C24919D0057_P00002_-NONE-_-NONE-
System-generated database key used to uniquely identify each financial assistance transaction record and
facilitate record lookup, correction, and deletion. A concatenation of
AwardModificationAmendmentNumber, AwardingSubTierAgencyCode, FAIN, and URI with a single
underscore ('_') character inserted in between each. If a field is blank, it is recorded as "- none-".

from the government.

The name of the awardee or recipient that relates to the unique identifier. For U.S. based companies, this

===== PAGE 458 =====

name is what the business ordinarily files in formation documents with individual states (when required).

name is what the business ordinarily files in formation documents with individual states (when required).
organization.awards.debts.recipients.duns [string] e.g.: 804735132
The D-U-N-S® Number, a proprietary organizational identifier owned and managed by Dun & Bradstreet
Inc, provides unique identification of a subject organization, in accordance with the Data Universal
Numbering System (D-U-N-S®).

organization.awards.debts.recipients.telephone [array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.awards.debts.recipients.telephone.telephoneNu
mber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.
organization.awards.debts.recipients.fax [array (object)]
The details of the facsimile information used for data communication with the entity.
organization.awards.debts.recipients.fax.faxNumber [string] e.g.: 6505550001
A sequence of digits used for facsimile communication with the entity.
This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

organization.awards.debts.recipients.address.postalCode [string] e.g.: 941109999
The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

nsion[string] e.g.: 9999

the Postal Code.

information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock
appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above market earnings

on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

organization.awards.debts.actions [array (object)]
Records information about the action taken under the award; the amount of money granted or
de-obligated, relevant dates and the type of action.

Records the changes made to the Federal prime award.
organization.awards.debts.actions.actionType.code [string] e.g.: A1
A code which specifies the changes made to the Federal prime award. e.g., . C for Revision, A for New.

The text specifying the business area.

===== PAGE 465 =====

The text specifying the record type.

record; new record.

The text specifying how the record should be processed.

reached.

The fiscal year of the action being reported was issued / signed by the Government or a binding
agreement was reached.

award transaction.

e[number] e.g.: 250000
The monetary figure specifying the Federal government’s obligation, deobligation, or liability for an award
transaction.

ency[string] e.g.: USD
The three-letter currency code, defined in the ISO 4217 scheme published by the International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) identifying the type of money in which this amount is expressed
(e.g., USD, CAD, GBP, EUR).
organization.awards.debts.actions.nonFederalFundingAmount [object]
Records the amount of the award funded by non-Federal source(s), in dollars. Program Income (as
defined in 2 CFR § 200.80) is not included until such time that Program Income is generated and credited
to the agreement.

CFR § 200.80) is not included until such time that Program Income is generated and credited to the
agreement.

organization.awards.debts.actions.effectiveDate [string] e.g.: 2019-07-22
The date on which, for the award referred to by the action being reported, awardee effort begins or the
award is otherwise effective.
organization.awards.debts.actions.expirationDate [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
The current date on which, for the award referred to by the action being reported, awardee effort
completes or the award is otherwise ended. Administrative actions related to this award may continue to
occur after this date. This date does not apply to procurement indefinite delivery vehicles under which
definitive orders may be awarded.
organization.awards.debts.actions.potentialExpirationDate [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22
A date describes that for procurement, the date on which, for the award referred to by the action being
reported if all potential pre-determined or prenegotiated options were exercised, awardee effort is
completed or the award is otherwise ended. Administrative actions related to this award may continue to
occur after this date. This date does not apply to procurement indefinite delivery vehicles under which
definitive orders may be awarded.
organization.awards.debts.actions.deliveryVehicleOrderExpira [string] e.g.: 2021-07-22

===== PAGE 467 =====

tionDate A Date describes that for procurement, the date on which, for the award referred to by the action being
reported, no additional orders referring to it may be placed. This date applies only to procurement indefinite
delivery vehicles (such as indefinite delivery contracts or blanket purchase agreements). Administrative
actions related to this award may continue to occur after this date. The period of performance end dates
for procurement orders issued under the indefinite delivery vehicle may extend beyond this date.
organization.awards.debts.actions.actionsCount [integer] e.g.: 150
A number input by the agency that identifies number of actions that are reported in one modification.

organization.awards.debts.subAwards.recipients.telephone [array (object)]
The details of the Telephone contact information used for voice communication with the organization.
organization.awards.debts.subAwards.recipients.telephone.tel
ephoneNumber[string] e.g.: 6505550000
The primary voice telephone number for the business, when dialing domestically. The National Telephone
Number is created by combining the Domestic Area Code and the Local Number.
A Domestic Area Code is a series of numbers that must be prefixed before dialing a telephone number in
another local area. National telecommunication authorities use various formats and dialing rules for area
codes. Also known as City Code.
A Local Number is a series of numbers that represents a specific telephone line.
organization.awards.debts.subAwards.recipients.fax [array (object)]
The details of the facsimile information used for data communication with the entity.
organization.awards.debts.subAwards.recipients.fax.faxNumb
er[string] e.g.: 6505550001
A sequence of digits used for facsimile communication with the entity.
This sequence of digits includes the area code or city code and domestic dialing code.

alCode The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

organization.awards.debts.subAwards.recipients.highlyCompe
nsatedOfficers.name[string] e.g.: NANCY KIPPER

means officers, managing partners, or any other employees in the sub awardee's management positions.
organization.awards.debts.subAwards.recipients.highlyCompe
nsatedOfficers.totalCompensationAmount[object]
Records the cash and noncash dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock
appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

nsatedOfficers.totalCompensationAmount.value[number] e.g.: 250000
The cash and noncash US dollar value earned by the one of the five most highly compensated
“Executives” during the sub-awardee's preceding fiscal year and includes the following (for more
information see 17 CFR 229.402c2): salary and bonuses, awards of stock, stock options, and stock
appreciation rights, earnings for services under non-equity incentive plans, change in pension value, above
market earnings on deferred compensation which is not tax qualified, and other compensation.

nsatedOfficers.sequence[integer] e.g.: 1

organization.exclusions [object]
Exclusions, formerly known as debarments, identify instances when an organization, person, or vessel has
been barred from doing business with the federal government for any number of reasons including
outstanding debts, criminal activity, and foreign associations among other issues.
organization.exclusions.hasActiveExclusions [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if the exclusion is active as of the date collected.
If true; it denotes that the exclusion is active.
organization.exclusions.hasInactiveExclusions [boolean] e.g.: true
Indicates if the exclusion was not active as of the date collected.
If true; it denotes that the exclusion was not active.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusionsCount [integer] e.g.: 12
The number of exclusions that were active on date collected.
organization.exclusions.inactiveExclusionsCount [integer] e.g.: 7
The number of exclusions that were not active on date collected.
organization.exclusions.mostRecentActiveExclusionDate [string] e.g.: 2018-09-12
The date of the last exclusion that was active.
organization.exclusions.mostRecentInactiveExclusionDate [string] e.g.: 2019-12-02
The date of the last exclusion that was inactive.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions [array (object)]
Records details about the active exclusions.

===== PAGE 476 =====

organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.samRecordNumber [string] e.g.: S4MR3MNRY
The internal number used by System for Award Management (SAM) to identify exclusion.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.cageCode [string] e.g.: 3V6L6
The Commercial and Government Entity(CAGE) code associated with the excluded entity.
Clarification Note:
1. Mostly found on Firm exclusion records, but could be in other types if the Individual, Special Entity, or
Vessel has a CAGE Code.
2. CAGE code is required for any business, organization, or agency that is eligible to, or plans to, receive
payments from the federal government.
A fully accurate and compliant SAM(System for Award Management) registration is required in order to
obtain a CAGE code and qualify for federal contracts or grants. More importantly, if you have already
completed a government contract or have been awarded a grant, an up-todate SAM registration and a
current CAGE code are required in order for you to receive payment.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.classificationType [object]
Records the categorization of the exclusion, e.g., firm, individual, special entity designation, vessel.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.classificationType.de
scription[string] e.g.: Firm
Text that specifies the categorization of the exclusion, e.g., firm, individual, special entity designation,
vessel.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.classificationType.dn
bCode[integer] e.g.: 35562
A unique code assigned by Dun&Bradstreet that specifies the categorization of the exclusion, e.g., firm,
individual, special entity designation, vessel.
Refer to Reference code table "815 [Exclusion Classification Type]" for all possible values.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.programType [object]
Records the exclusion program, e.g., Reciprocal, Nonreciprocal or Procurement.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.programType.descri
ption[string] e.g.: Reciprocal
Text that specifies the exclusion program, e.g., Reciprocal, Nonreciprocal or Procurement.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.programType.dnbCo
de[integer] e.g.: 35568
A unique code assigned by Dun&Bradstreet that specifies the exclusion program, e.g., Reciprocal,
Nonreciprocal or Procurement.
Refer to Reference code table "816 [Exclusion Program Type]" for all possible values.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.reason [object]
Records the reason for which the entity is being excluded.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.reason.description [string] e.g.: Prohibition/Restriction
Text that specifies the reason for which the entity is being excluded.

organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.reason.dnbCode [integer] e.g.: 35569
A unique code assigned by Dun&Bradstreet that specifies the reason for which the entity is being
excluded.

The code which identifies the legacy Excluded Parties List System (EPLS) Cause & Treatment (CT) Code
associated with the exclusion.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.agencyName [string] e.g.: EPA
Text specifying the name of the Agency which created this exclusion.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.effectiveDate [string] e.g.: 2012-05-21
The date that the exclusion went active.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.expirationDate [string] e.g.: 2024-09-12
The date when the exclusion is expected to cease.

ate[string] e.g.: 2014-07-30

this Facility Only: (Violating Facility) California Shellfish Company d.b.a. Point Adams Packing Company,
482 Fleet Street, Hammond, OR 97121
The text that specifies additional information as necessary by the Agency creating the exclusion.
organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.nationalProviderID [string] e.g.: 1992878136
The National Provider Identifier (NPI) associated with the exclusion.
Clarification Note:
Healthcare providers acquire their unique 10-digit NPIs from the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services
(CMS) at the Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) to identify themselves in a standard way
throughout their industry.

Single name by which the organization is primarily known or identified.

organization.exclusions.activeExclusions.address.postalCode [string] e.g.: 941109999
The postal code for this address of the organization.
Also known locally in various English-speaking countries throughout the world as a postcode, post code,
Eircode, PIN or ZIP Code) is a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or
punctuation, included in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. The code is used by the country's
postal authority to identify the address where the organization is located or conducts operations .

organization.violations [object]
Records details of proceedings against subject business for failure to comply with the standards of the
different government agencies.
organization.violations.hasEPAViolations [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true"; it indicates that there were violations recorded on the company by the Environmental
Protection Agency (EPA).
When set to "false"; it indicates that there were no violations recorded on the company by the
Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).
organization.violations.hasOSHAViolations [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true"; it indicates that there were violations recorded on the company by the Occupational
Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).
When set to "false"; it indicates that there were no violations recorded on the company by the
Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).
organization.violations.hasGCLCitations [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true"; it indicates that there were citations of the company in the Government Control List
(GCL).
When set to "false"; it indicates that there were no citations of the company in the Government Control List
(GCL).
organization.violations.hasCAEnvironmentalViolations [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true"; it indicates that there were violations recorded on the company by the Canadian
Environmental Protection Agency.
When set to "false"; it indicates that there were no violations recorded on the company by the Canadian
Environmental Protection Agency.
organization.violations.hasDOLWagesHoursViolations [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true"; it indicates that there were violations of the wage and hour violation act recorded on
the company by the Department Of Labor (DOL).
When set to "false"; it indicates that there were no violations of the wage and hour violation act recorded
on the company by the Department Of Labor (DOL).
organization.violations.hasMedicareNursingHomeViolations [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true"; it indicates that there were citations issued from the inspections carried on the nursing

===== PAGE 484 =====

home for not meeting specific federal standards.
When set to "false"; it indicates that there were no citations issued from the inspections carried on the
nursing home for not meeting specific federal standards.
organization.violations.totalEPAViolationsCount [integer] e.g.: 3
The total number of violations recorded by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on the subject
company.
organization.violations.mostRecentEPAViolationDate [string] e.g.: 2018-09-12
The date when the last violation was recorded by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on the
subject company.
organization.violations.totalEPAViolationsAmount [object]
Records the total amount involved in the violations recorded on the company.
organization.violations.totalEPAViolationsAmount.value [number] e.g.: 125000.5
The total amount involved in the violations recorded on the company.
organization.violations.totalOSHAViolationsCount [integer] e.g.: 3
The total number of violations recorded by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) on
the subject company.
organization.violations.mostRecentOSHAViolationDate [string] e.g.: 2018-09-12
The date when the last violation was recorded by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration
(OSHA) on the subject company.
organization.violations.totalOSHAViolationsAmount [object]
Records the total amount involved in the violations recorded by the Occupational Safety and Health
Administration (OSHA) on the company.
organization.violations.totalOSHAViolationsAmount.value [number] e.g.: 125000.5
The total amount involved in the violations recorded on the company.
organization.violations.totalGCLCitationsCount [integer] e.g.: 3
The total number of citations recorded by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on the subject
company.
organization.violations.mostRecentGCLCitationDate [string] e.g.: 2018-09-12
The date when the last violation was recorded by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on the
subject company.
organization.violations.totalGCLCitationsAmount [object]
Records the total amount involved in the violations recorded on the company.
organization.violations.totalGCLCitationsAmount.value [number] e.g.: 125000.5

===== PAGE 485 =====

The total amount involved in the violations recorded on the company.

company.

organization.violations.epaViolations [array (object)]
Records details of the violations recorded on the company by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).
organization.violations.epaViolations.hasAirFacility [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility has an air facility system.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility doesn't have air facility system.
organization.violations.epaViolations.hasCleanWaterPermit [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility has National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System's clean
water permit as per Clean Water Act.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility doesn't have National Pollutant Discharge Elimination
System's clean water permit as per Clean Water Act.
organization.violations.epaViolations.hasSDWISPermit [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility has Safe Drinking Water Information System permit as per
Environmental Protection Agency(EPA).
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility doesn't have Safe Drinking Water Information System
permit as per Environmental Protection Agency(EPA).
organization.violations.epaViolations.hasRCRAPermit [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility has Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information
System permit.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility doesn't have Resource Conservation and Recovery Act
Information System permit.
organization.violations.epaViolations.hasTRIPermit [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility has Toxic Release Inventory permit.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility doesn't have Toxic Release Inventory permit.
organization.violations.epaViolations.hasGreenHouseGasPer
mit[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility has Green House Gas permit.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility doesn't have Green House Gas permit.
organization.violations.epaViolations.reportURL [string] e.g.: http://echo.epa.gov/detailed-facility-report?fid=110001341441
Text that provides the Web page address having detailed compliance history report about the facility.
organization.violations.epaViolations.registryServiceID [number] e.g.: 110001340000
A number that uniquely identifies the program regulated by the facility registry service.
Note: Facilities may be regulated under more than one environmental statute depending on the size and
nature of the operations of the facility.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityName [string] e.g.: SUPERIOR MFG GROUP

===== PAGE 487 =====

The name of the company or permit holder as maintained by Facility registry service.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress [object]
Records the address details of the facility or the permit holder.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.streetAdd
ress[object]
Records any of the address details that cannot be provided in a more granular format; e.g., building, street,
estate of the facility or permit holder.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.streetAdd
ress.line1[string] e.g.: 1, King street
Text that describes any of the address details that cannot be provided in a more granular format; e.g.,
building, street, estate of the facility or permit holder.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.addressL
ocality[object]
Records the town or city recognized by the Postal Authority for delivering mail to the facility or permit
holder.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.addressL
ocality.name[string] e.g.: Townsend
The name of the town or city recognized by the Postal Authority for delivering mail to the facility or permit
holder.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.addressR
egion[object]
Records the state or territory of the facility or permit holder.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.addressR
egion.name[string] e.g.: California
The name of the state or territory of the facility or permit holder.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.postalCo
de[string] e.g.: true
An identifier used by the local country Postal Authority to identify a particular geographic location.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.addressC
ounty[object]
Records the administrative division within a Territory or Country for this Role Player involved in this
Commercial Credit Claim. As a guiding principle this is a geographic area which would be classified as a
Province (except Canada) or a County. In the U.S. this would be a county within a State. In the UK this
would be a county in one of the Home Nations. In Republic Of Ireland, this would be a county and there
would be no State.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.addressC
ounty.name[string] e.g.: Morris
A primary administrative division within a Territory or Country for this Role Player involved in this
Commercial Credit Claim. As a guiding principle this is a geographic area which would be classified as a
Province (except Canada) or a County. In the U.S. this would be a county within a State. In the UK this
would be a county in one of the Home Nations. In Republic Of Ireland, this would be a county and there
would be no State.
organization.violations.epaViolations.facilityAddress.addressC [string] e.g.: 6120

===== PAGE 488 =====

ounty.fipsCode The 2 digit state federal information processing system code concatenated with the 3 digit County federal
information processing system code.
organization.violations.epaViolations.epaAdmimistrativeRegio
nCode[string] e.g.: 05
A code value that identifies the geographic Active permit administrative region of the environmental
protection agency.
organization.violations.epaViolations.isFederalFacility [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility is provided for leasing to the federal government.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility is not provided for leasing to the federal government.
organization.violations.epaViolations.isMajor [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility is a major facility based on the environmental protection
agency and state standards.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility is not a major facility based on the environmental protection
agency and state standards.
organization.violations.epaViolations.isPermitActive [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the permit of the facility is active.
When set to "false" it indicates that the permit of the facility is not active.
Note: A flag indicating any of the associated ICIS-Air, ICIS-NPDES, RCRA or SDWA permits are active.
organization.violations.epaViolations.sicV4Codes [string] e.g.: 5244
A numeric and/or alpha value which may be used to identify a business activity performed by the facility.
Note: The 4-digit Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code that represents the economic activity of a
company. The NAICS classification system replaced the SIC classification system in 1997. These codes
are no longer collected by some EPA programs.
organization.violations.epaViolations.naicsCodes [string] e.g.: 339999 326199 326192
A numeric and/or alpha value which may be used to identify a business activity performed by the facility.
Note: The 6-digit North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code that represents a
subdivision of an industry that accommodates user needs in the United States.
organization.violations.epaViolations.federalAgencyName [string] e.g.: Postal Service
The name of the federal agency that represents the facility.
Note: If the facility is part of a Federal Agency, the federal agency's name is displayed, as classified in
Facility registry service.
organization.violations.epaViolations.impairedWaterCategory
Code[integer] e.g.: 1
A code value (i.e. single digit) that identifies the facility is discharging into water as impaired (category 4 or
category 5) in the Watershed Assessment, Tracking & Environmental ResultS (WATERS) database.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile [object]
Records the location of the facity or permit holder
based on the geo-spatial data gathered from the longitude and lattitude coordinates

===== PAGE 489 =====

and other proximity information.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.isWith
inTribalBoundary[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility is located within a Native American tribal boundary.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility is not located within a Native American tribal boundary.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.myRT
KCode[string] e.g.: NNN
A code value that denotes the 3 digit combination of Y/N flags indicating if the facility is considered as
myRTK.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.isEJS
creeningLocation[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility in the geographical areas warrants further screening under
environmental justice (EJ) indexes of EJSCREEN.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility in the geographical areas does not warrants further
screening under environmental justice (EJ) indexes of EJSCREEN.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.isUS
MexicoBorderLocation[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility is located within 100KM of the US-Mexico Border.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility is located not within 100KM of the US-Mexico Border.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.isChe
sapeakeBayLocation[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility is located within the Chesapeake Bay watershed area.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility is not located within the Chesapeake Bay watershed area.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.isNon
AttainmentLocation[boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true" it indicates that the facility is located within an Air Non Attainment area.
When set to "false" it indicates that the facility is not located within an Air Non Attainment area.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.latitud
e[number] e.g.: 13.526789
The latitude of the facility in decimal degrees expressed using the NAD83 horizontal datum. The
coordinate comes from the FRS EPA Locational Reference Tables (LRT) file which represents the most
accurate value for the facility based on the available spatial metadata.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.longit
ude[number] e.g.: -81.321548
The longitude of the facility in decimal degrees expressed using the NAD83 horizontal datum. The
coordinate comes from the FRS EPA Locational Reference Tables (LRT) file which represents the most
accurate value for the facility based on the available spatial metadata.
organization.violations.epaViolations.demoraphicProfile.mapIc
onFileName[string] e.g.: CWA-IA-MN-N.png
The name that describes the default map icon image file calculated for the facility by the ECHO program.

natesDataCollectionMethod[string] e.g.: ADDRESS MATCHING-HOUSE NUMBER

facility coordinate.

(and not of Hispanic origin) from the total people.

ationDensity The number of people per square mile within a 3-mile radius i.e. the ratio of total people to total land area.

CWA, and RCRA in the last five years.
organization.violations.epaViolations.complianceScreening.m
ostRecentFullInspectionDate[string] e.g.: 2018-09-12
The date when the last inspection of the facility took place. For the Clean Air Act, the date on which a Full
Compliance Evaluation (FCE) was completed. This date may or may not correspond to an actual site visit.
A series of partial onor off-site inspections may have been conducted during the fiscal year as part of this
FCE.

ceLastInspectionDaysCount[integer] e.g.: 10

on ICISAir, ICIS-NPDES, or RCRAInfo.

organization.violations.epaViolations.complianceScreening.m

facility.
organization.violations.epaViolations.complianceScreening.inf
ormalEnforcementActionsCount[integer] e.g.: 10
The total number of informal enforcement actions/NOVs that have been taken against the facility within the
twenty most recently completed quarters (5 years).
Note : Notices of Violation are activities taken by EPA or the state that often precede a formal
administrative or civil/ judicial enforcement action. Not all notices of violation are escalated to formal
enforcement action for a variety of reasons, including the following: the facility quickly corrects the
problem(s) indicated in the notice, the violation is determined to be less severe than originally thought, or
consultation between the facility and EPA or the state indicates that a violation has not occurred. Based on
data recorded in ICIS-Air, ICIS-NPDES, SDWIS, and
RCRAInfo.

organization.violations.epaViolations.complianceScreening.no
nCompliantQuartersCount[integer] e.g.: 10
A Count of the number of quarters, out of the last twelve quarters, in which the permit or site is considered
either in Noncompliance (NC), Significant Noncompliance (SNC) or High Priority violation (HPV) status. A
quarter is any of the following 3-month calendar periods: January-March, April-June, July-September, or
October-December.

sSignificantNonCompliance[boolean] e.g.: true
The Indicator denotes Whether the facility is a High Priority Violator (HPV) for CAA, in Significant
Noncompliance (SNC) for CWA or RCRA, or a Serious Violator for SDWA currently for CAA and RCRA, or
during the most current quarter in CWA and SDWA, as of the time the data were extracted from the
program data systems.
organization.violations.epaViolations.complianceScreening.sig
nificantNonCompliantProgramsCount[integer] e.g.: 10

violation.
organization.violations.epaViolations.complianceScreening.co
mplianceStatusDescription[string] e.g.: No Violation Identified
A text that decribes the Current compliance status of the facility or permit holder.for more details on
compliance status http://echo.epa.gov/ dfr_data_dictionary#compsum
Current Values: SNC/Serious Viol, In Violation,
No Violation, Unknown, NULL.
Order equals priority if multiple programs/permits exist.
A NULL value indicates that there are no CAA, CWA, SDWA, or RCRA
permits associated with the FRS Facility.

===== PAGE 494 =====

eType.description A text that describes the type of regulatory statute that is associated with the facility registry service
information.
organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.hasSi
gnificantNonCompliance[boolean] e.g.: true
The indicator that describes the current Significant Noncompliance (SNC) or High Priority Violator (HPV)
status for the facility during the most current quarter reflects the time the records were extracted from the
program data systems. SNC is used for RCRA and CWA, and HPV is used for CAA programs. Each
program has its own specific criteria for making this determination. The value of "Yes" indicates the facility
is in SNC or HPV for the permit or site in question and may pose a more severe level of environmental
threat. The value of "No" indicates the permit or site is not considered in SNC or HPV.
organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.isHigh
PriorityViolator[boolean] e.g.: true
The indicator that describes the current Significant Noncompliance (SNC) or High Priority Violator (HPV)
status for the facility during the most current quarter reflects the time the records were extracted from the
program data systems. SNC is used for RCRA and CWA, and HPV is used for CAA programs. Each
program has its own specific criteria for making this determination. The value of "Yes" indicates the facility
is in SNC or HPV for the permit or site in question and may pose a more severe level of environmental
threat. The value of "No" indicates the permit or site is not considered in SNC or HPV.
organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.permit
Type[string] e.g.: Minor
Text that describes the identifier(s) associated with the facility reported by a regulatory statute.

Codes[string] e.g.: 3069 3996
Text that describes the Permit Types associated with the Facility reported by FRS.
Values include:
Major, Federally Reportable Minor, Other Minor, Synthetic Minor,Major and Minor and NULL.
TSDF = Treatment, Storage and Disposal facility
LQG = Large Quantity Generator SQG = Small Quantity Generator CESQG = Conditionally-Exempt Small
Quantity Generator
Operating TSDF Transporters
organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.naics

The text that describes the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) has replaced the U.S.
Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) system. All available NAICS codes are shown.
organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.inspe
ctionsCount[integer] e.g.: 10
The text that describes the Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) codes, as maintained by each data
system. SIC codes were established by the Census Bureau to identify processes, products and services.
Each data system has different criteria for incorporating this information (e.g., for EPCRA 313, the SIC
codes are self-reported by the facility each year). All available SIC codes are shown.

corresponding statute, within the last five years. The last 5 years will include data from the 20 most

recently completed quarters, plus data from the current quarter up until the refresh date. This count only

precede a formal administrative or civil/judicial enforcement action. Not all notices of violation are
escalated to formal enforcement action for a variety of reasons, including the following: the facility quickly
corrects the problem(s) indicated in the notice, the violation is determined to be less severe than originally
thought, or consultation between the facility and EPA or the state indicates that a violation has not
occurred.

organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.totalP

The total dollar amount of either assessed (or final) penalties.
Clarification Note: This count only includes penalties that have been entered in the program databases:
ICIS-Air, ICIS-NPDES, and RCRAInfo.
Federal CAA, CWA-NPDES, and RCRA penalties that have been entered into ICIS are not included in this
section to avoid duplicative counting. This count does not include proposed penalties in RCRAInfo or the
cost of Supplemental Environmental Projects (SEPs).

in the program databases: ICIS-Air, ICIS-NPDES, and RCRAInfo. Federal CAA, CWANPDES, and RCRA
penalties that have been entered into ICIS are not included. This count does not include proposed

organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.three
YearsQuarterlyComplianceAssessment[string] e.g.: VSSSSVVVVVVV
"The text that describes the history of 3 year compliance status by quarter.
For more details on compliance status http://echo.epa.gov/help/reports/dfrdata-dictionary#AirComp"
http://echo.epa.gov/help/reports/dfrdata-dictionary#RCRAComp
organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.compl
ianceStatus[string] e.g.: On
The Compliance Tracking classifications can assist you in interpreting the compliance status, particular for
non-major standard permittees.
In ICIS-NPDES, the database must be set to make a facility-level compliance determination. There are
several components of compliance tracking, including Discharge Monitoring Report (DMR) non-receipt
tracking and facilitylevel compliance status tracking.
Regarding the ECHO menu choices, "On" generally means data are being entered, and all system
compliance tracking is on. "Partial" generally means data are being entered, effluent exceedances and
most facility-level status types are being identified, but DMR non-receipt is not being tracked. "Off"
generally means data are not being entered and/or all compliance tracking is off (system won't determine
facility-level compliance status).
organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.thirtee
nQuartersComplianceAssessment[string] e.g.: VVSSSSVVVVVVV
The text that describes the 13 quarters (3 years plus 3 months) compliance status by quarter, which is
derived from the QNCR Code. For more detail, see
http://echo.epa.gov/help/reports/dfrdata-dictionary#CWAComp
organization.violations.epaViolations.regulatoryStatutes.thirtee [integer] e.g.: 10

===== PAGE 497 =====

plus 3 months (13 quarters).

When set to "false" it indicates that the facility hasn't reported releases to toxics inventory release from the
prior reporting year.

recent reporting year.

most recent reporting year.

The full name of an individual or an organization.
organization.violations.governmentControlLists.familyName [string] e.g.: John
The family name of an individual, in western cultures this is usually presented last.
organization.violations.governmentControlLists.givenName [string] e.g.: Smith
The first name of an individual. If this is not known then an initial may be supplied.
The first name may contain more than one word (E.g.: Anne Marie, Jean Charles).
organization.violations.governmentControlLists.middleName [string] e.g.: Jay
A middle name of an individual. If this is not known then an initial may be supplied.

A code identifying either a familial suffix to the spouse's name (E.g. Senior, Junior, III. ) or a professional/
qualification suffix to the spouse's name (E.g. MD, FRICS, PhD etc.) or some other suffix to the spouse's
name (E.g. Baronet, Retired.).

organization.violations.oshaInspections [array (object)]
Records details of the inspections recorded on the company by the Occupational Safety and Health
Administration (OSHA).
organization.violations.oshaInspections.reportingOrganizationI
D[string] e.g.: ID123
An identifer for the OSHA office or organizational unit that has reported the inspection in this organization
organization.violations.oshaInspections.establishmentName [string] e.g.: Name

===== PAGE 507 =====

The name of the company or site which is subjected to inspection.
organization.violations.oshaInspections.inspectionType [string] e.g.: A
The textual code that indicates the impetus for actually performing the inspection; e.g., may be part of a
planned schedule, accident, complaint, etc.
The expected values are: A=Accident.
B=Complaint. C=Referral. D=Monitoring. E=Variance. F=FollowUp. G=Unprog Rel. H=Planned.
I=Prog Related. J=Unprog Other. K=Prog Other. L=Other-L
organization.violations.oshaInspections.inspectionScope [string] e.g.: B
A textual code that indicates the scope of the inspection.
The expected values are: A=Complete.
B=Partial. C=Records. D=NoInspection
organization.violations.oshaInspections.startDate [string] e.g.: 2018-09-12
The date on which the inspection started.
organization.violations.oshaInspections.loadCompleteDate [string] e.g.: 2018-09-12
The date on which the inspection detail is loaded to the Occupational Safety And Health Administration
system.
organization.violations.oshaInspections.usSICV4 [string] e.g.: 3721
A code that describes the Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) codes assigned to this establishment.
SIC codes were established by the Census Bureau to identify processes, products and services. Each
data system has different criteria for incorporating this information (e.g., for EPCRA 313, the SIC codes
are self-reported by the facility each year). All available SIC codes are shown.
organization.violations.oshaInspections.naicsCode [string] e.g.: 637321
A code that describes the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) assigned to this
establishment.
organization.violations.oshaInspections.ownerType [string] e.g.: A
A code that describess the type of ownership the site that is subjected to inspection has.
organization.violations.oshaInspections.ownerCode [string] e.g.: 1245A
A numeric code that further that describes the owner for owner type 'D'
organization.violations.oshaInspections.hasAdvancedNotice [boolean] e.g.: true
When set to "true", it indicates that advance notice was given for the pending inspection.
When set to "false" indicates that there was no advance notice given for the pending inspection.
organization.violations.oshaInspections.noInspectionReason [string] e.g.: A
A textual code that indicates the reason for unavailability of inspection information.
Expected values are :
A=No Insp/Not Found. B=No Insp/Out of Business. C=No Insp/Process Inactive.

===== PAGE 508 =====

D=No Insp/10 or Fewer Empe. E=No Insp/Denied Entry.
F=No Insp/SIC not on PG. G=No Insp/Exempt Voluntary. H=No Insp/NonExempt Consult. I=No Insp/Other.
J=No Insp/Employer Exempted By Appropriation Act
organization.violations.oshaInspections.unionAffiliationStatus [string] e.g.: B
Indicates whether employees covered by inspection were affiliated with a union.

not affected by updating in April. 2004 or later will have zero in this field.

organization.violations.oshaInspections.violations.events.histo
ryEventType[string] e.g.: B
A code that indicates the type of violation event generated based on the violation event reported.

===== PAGE 511 =====

Valid values are : Z=Issued.
P=Petition to Mod Abatement. I=Informal Settlement.
A=Amendment. W=Empr Withdrew. D=Govt Dismissed. L=State Settlement. Y=State Decision. F=Formal
Settlement. J=ALJ Decision.
R=Review Commission. 1=State Lower Court.
2=Appeals Court. 3=Supreme Court

RatingAndFootnotes[array (object)]
Records details of the footnotes attached to the nursing home rating.
organization.violations.medicareNursingHomeViolations.home

A text describes the rating and footnote of facilties in nursing home . E.g .Health Inspection,QM,Long-stay
QM, Short-Stay QM ,Staffing,RN,etc.
organization.violations.medicareNursingHomeViolations.home

The rating of health inspection provided in nursing homes.
The Rating of Quality measure(QM) of care provided in nursing homes. The rating of Long Stay Quality
measure(QM) provided in nursing home.
The rating of Short Stay Quality measure(QM) provided in nursing home.
The rating of Staffing as provided in nursing home.
The rating of Registered Nurse (RN) Staffing as provided in nursing home.

The rating footnote of health inspection provided in nursing homes.

The rating footnote of Reported Staffing as provided in nursing home.
The rating footnote of Physical Therapy Staffing as provided in nursing home.
Response for HTTP Status Code : 301
Response Headers
Name Details
location [string] e.g.: https://plus.dnb.com/v1/data/duns/{dunsNumber}?blockIDs=blockID1,blockID2,blockID3,..
The URL to retrieve the D-U-N-S Number to which the requested D-U-N-S Number was transferred.
